ff.c

3/-----------------------------------------------------------------------------/

6/
7/ FatFs module is an open source software. Redistribution and use of FatFs in
8/ source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided
9/ that the following condition is met:

12/ this condition and the following disclaimer.

15/ and any warranties related to this software are DISCLAIMED.
16/ The copyright owner or contributors be NOT LIABLE for any damages caused
17/ by use of this software.

20
21#include "ff.h" /* Declarations of FatFs API */
22
23#include <string.h>
24
25#include "diskio.h" /* Declarations of device I/O functions */
26
27/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------
28
29 Module Private Definitions
30
31---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
32
33#if FF_DEFINED != 80286 /* Revision ID */
34#error Wrong include file (ff.h).
35#endif
36
37/* Limits and boundaries */
38#define MAX_DIR 0x200000 /* Max size of FAT directory */
39#define MAX_DIR_EX 0x10000000 /* Max size of exFAT directory */
40#define MAX_FAT12 0xFF5 /* Max FAT12 clusters (differs from specs, but right for real DOS/Windows behavior) */
41#define MAX_FAT16 0xFFF5 /* Max FAT16 clusters (differs from specs, but right for real DOS/Windows behavior) */
42#define MAX_FAT32 0x0FFFFFF5 /* Max FAT32 clusters (not specified, practical limit) */
43#define MAX_EXFAT 0x7FFFFFFD /* Max exFAT clusters (differs from specs, implementation limit) */
44
45/* Character code support macros */
46#define IsUpper(c) ((c) >= 'A' && (c) <= 'Z')
47#define IsLower(c) ((c) >= 'a' && (c) <= 'z')
48#define IsDigit(c) ((c) >= '0' && (c) <= '9')
49#define IsSeparator(c) ((c) == '/' || (c) == '\\')
50#define IsTerminator(c) ((UINT)(c) < (FF_USE_LFN ? ' ' : '!'))
51#define IsSurrogate(c) ((c) >= 0xD800 && (c) <= 0xDFFF)
52#define IsSurrogateH(c) ((c) >= 0xD800 && (c) <= 0xDBFF)
53#define IsSurrogateL(c) ((c) >= 0xDC00 && (c) <= 0xDFFF)
54
55/* Additional file access control and file status flags for internal use */
56#define FA_SEEKEND 0x20 /* Seek to end of the file on file open */
57#define FA_MODIFIED 0x40 /* File has been modified */
58#define FA_DIRTY 0x80 /* FIL.buf[] needs to be written-back */
59
60/* Additional file attribute bits for internal use */
61#define AM_VOL 0x08 /* Volume label */
62#define AM_LFN 0x0F /* LFN entry */
63#define AM_MASK 0x3F /* Mask of defined bits in FAT */
64#define AM_MASKX 0x37 /* Mask of defined bits in exFAT */
65
66/* Name status flags in fn[11] */
67#define NSFLAG 11 /* Index of the name status byte */
68#define NS_LOSS 0x01 /* Out of 8.3 format */
69#define NS_LFN 0x02 /* Force to create LFN entry */
70#define NS_LAST 0x04 /* Last segment */
71#define NS_BODY 0x08 /* Lower case flag (body) */
72#define NS_EXT 0x10 /* Lower case flag (ext) */
73#define NS_DOT 0x20 /* Dot entry */
74#define NS_NOLFN 0x40 /* Do not find LFN */
75#define NS_NONAME 0x80 /* Not followed */
76
77/* exFAT directory entry types */
78#define ET_BITMAP 0x81 /* Allocation bitmap */
79#define ET_UPCASE 0x82 /* Up-case table */
80#define ET_VLABEL 0x83 /* Volume label */
81#define ET_FILEDIR 0x85 /* File and directory */
82#define ET_STREAM 0xC0 /* Stream extension */
83#define ET_FILENAME 0xC1 /* Name extension */
84
85/* FatFs refers the FAT structure as simple byte array instead of structure member
86/ because the C structure is not binary compatible between different platforms */
87
88#define BS_JmpBoot 0 /* x86 jump instruction (3-byte) */
89#define BS_OEMName 3 /* OEM name (8-byte) */
90#define BPB_BytsPerSec 11 /* Sector size [byte] (WORD) */
91#define BPB_SecPerClus 13 /* Cluster size [sector] (BYTE) */
92#define BPB_RsvdSecCnt 14 /* Size of reserved area [sector] (WORD) */
93#define BPB_NumFATs 16 /* Number of FATs (BYTE) */
94#define BPB_RootEntCnt 17 /* Size of root directory area for FAT [entry] (WORD) */
95#define BPB_TotSec16 19 /* Volume size (16-bit) [sector] (WORD) */
96#define BPB_Media 21 /* Media descriptor byte (BYTE) */
97#define BPB_FATSz16 22 /* FAT size (16-bit) [sector] (WORD) */
98#define BPB_SecPerTrk 24 /* Number of sectors per track for int13h [sector] (WORD) */
99#define BPB_NumHeads 26 /* Number of heads for int13h (WORD) */
100#define BPB_HiddSec 28 /* Volume offset from top of the drive (DWORD) */
101#define BPB_TotSec32 32 /* Volume size (32-bit) [sector] (DWORD) */
102#define BS_DrvNum 36 /* Physical drive number for int13h (BYTE) */
103#define BS_NTres 37 /* WindowsNT error flag (BYTE) */
104#define BS_BootSig 38 /* Extended boot signature (BYTE) */
105#define BS_VolID 39 /* Volume serial number (DWORD) */
106#define BS_VolLab 43 /* Volume label string (8-byte) */
107#define BS_FilSysType 54 /* Filesystem type string (8-byte) */
108#define BS_BootCode 62 /* Boot code (448-byte) */
109#define BS_55AA 510 /* Signature word (WORD) */
110
111#define BPB_FATSz32 36 /* FAT32: FAT size [sector] (DWORD) */
112#define BPB_ExtFlags32 40 /* FAT32: Extended flags (WORD) */
113#define BPB_FSVer32 42 /* FAT32: Filesystem version (WORD) */
114#define BPB_RootClus32 44 /* FAT32: Root directory cluster (DWORD) */
115#define BPB_FSInfo32 48 /* FAT32: Offset of FSINFO sector (WORD) */
116#define BPB_BkBootSec32 50 /* FAT32: Offset of backup boot sector (WORD) */
117#define BS_DrvNum32 64 /* FAT32: Physical drive number for int13h (BYTE) */
118#define BS_NTres32 65 /* FAT32: Error flag (BYTE) */
119#define BS_BootSig32 66 /* FAT32: Extended boot signature (BYTE) */
120#define BS_VolID32 67 /* FAT32: Volume serial number (DWORD) */
121#define BS_VolLab32 71 /* FAT32: Volume label string (8-byte) */
122#define BS_FilSysType32 82 /* FAT32: Filesystem type string (8-byte) */
123#define BS_BootCode32 90 /* FAT32: Boot code (420-byte) */
124
125#define BPB_ZeroedEx 11 /* exFAT: MBZ field (53-byte) */
126#define BPB_VolOfsEx 64 /* exFAT: Volume offset from top of the drive [sector] (QWORD) */
127#define BPB_TotSecEx 72 /* exFAT: Volume size [sector] (QWORD) */
128#define BPB_FatOfsEx 80 /* exFAT: FAT offset from top of the volume [sector] (DWORD) */
129#define BPB_FatSzEx 84 /* exFAT: FAT size [sector] (DWORD) */
130#define BPB_DataOfsEx 88 /* exFAT: Data offset from top of the volume [sector] (DWORD) */
131#define BPB_NumClusEx 92 /* exFAT: Number of clusters (DWORD) */
132#define BPB_RootClusEx 96 /* exFAT: Root directory start cluster (DWORD) */
133#define BPB_VolIDEx 100 /* exFAT: Volume serial number (DWORD) */
134#define BPB_FSVerEx 104 /* exFAT: Filesystem version (WORD) */
135#define BPB_VolFlagEx 106 /* exFAT: Volume flags (WORD) */
136#define BPB_BytsPerSecEx 108 /* exFAT: Log2 of sector size in unit of byte (BYTE) */
137#define BPB_SecPerClusEx 109 /* exFAT: Log2 of cluster size in unit of sector (BYTE) */
138#define BPB_NumFATsEx 110 /* exFAT: Number of FATs (BYTE) */
139#define BPB_DrvNumEx 111 /* exFAT: Physical drive number for int13h (BYTE) */
140#define BPB_PercInUseEx 112 /* exFAT: Percent in use (BYTE) */
141#define BPB_RsvdEx 113 /* exFAT: Reserved (7-byte) */
142#define BS_BootCodeEx 120 /* exFAT: Boot code (390-byte) */
143
144#define DIR_Name 0 /* Short file name (11-byte) */
145#define DIR_Attr 11 /* Attribute (BYTE) */
146#define DIR_NTres 12 /* Lower case flag (BYTE) */
147#define DIR_CrtTime10 13 /* Created time sub-second (BYTE) */
148#define DIR_CrtTime 14 /* Created time (DWORD) */
149#define DIR_LstAccDate 18 /* Last accessed date (WORD) */
150#define DIR_FstClusHI 20 /* Higher 16-bit of first cluster (WORD) */
151#define DIR_ModTime 22 /* Modified time (DWORD) */
152#define DIR_FstClusLO 26 /* Lower 16-bit of first cluster (WORD) */
153#define DIR_FileSize 28 /* File size (DWORD) */
154#define LDIR_Ord 0 /* LFN: LFN order and LLE flag (BYTE) */
155#define LDIR_Attr 11 /* LFN: LFN attribute (BYTE) */
156#define LDIR_Type 12 /* LFN: Entry type (BYTE) */
157#define LDIR_Chksum 13 /* LFN: Checksum of the SFN (BYTE) */
158#define LDIR_FstClusLO 26 /* LFN: MBZ field (WORD) */
159#define XDIR_Type 0 /* exFAT: Type of exFAT directory entry (BYTE) */
160#define XDIR_NumLabel 1 /* exFAT: Number of volume label characters (BYTE) */
161#define XDIR_Label 2 /* exFAT: Volume label (11-WORD) */
162#define XDIR_CaseSum 4 /* exFAT: Sum of case conversion table (DWORD) */
163#define XDIR_NumSec 1 /* exFAT: Number of secondary entries (BYTE) */
164#define XDIR_SetSum 2 /* exFAT: Sum of the set of directory entries (WORD) */
165#define XDIR_Attr 4 /* exFAT: File attribute (WORD) */
166#define XDIR_CrtTime 8 /* exFAT: Created time (DWORD) */
167#define XDIR_ModTime 12 /* exFAT: Modified time (DWORD) */
168#define XDIR_AccTime 16 /* exFAT: Last accessed time (DWORD) */
169#define XDIR_CrtTime10 20 /* exFAT: Created time subsecond (BYTE) */
170#define XDIR_ModTime10 21 /* exFAT: Modified time subsecond (BYTE) */
171#define XDIR_CrtTZ 22 /* exFAT: Created timezone (BYTE) */
172#define XDIR_ModTZ 23 /* exFAT: Modified timezone (BYTE) */
173#define XDIR_AccTZ 24 /* exFAT: Last accessed timezone (BYTE) */
174#define XDIR_GenFlags 33 /* exFAT: General secondary flags (BYTE) */
175#define XDIR_NumName 35 /* exFAT: Number of file name characters (BYTE) */
176#define XDIR_NameHash 36 /* exFAT: Hash of file name (WORD) */
177#define XDIR_ValidFileSize 40 /* exFAT: Valid file size (QWORD) */
178#define XDIR_FstClus 52 /* exFAT: First cluster of the file data (DWORD) */
179#define XDIR_FileSize 56 /* exFAT: File/Directory size (QWORD) */
180
181#define SZDIRE 32 /* Size of a directory entry */
182#define DDEM 0xE5 /* Deleted directory entry mark set to DIR_Name[0] */
183#define RDDEM 0x05 /* Replacement of the character collides with DDEM */
184#define LLEF 0x40 /* Last long entry flag in LDIR_Ord */
185
186#define FSI_LeadSig 0 /* FAT32 FSI: Leading signature (DWORD) */
187#define FSI_StrucSig 484 /* FAT32 FSI: Structure signature (DWORD) */
188#define FSI_Free_Count 488 /* FAT32 FSI: Number of free clusters (DWORD) */
189#define FSI_Nxt_Free 492 /* FAT32 FSI: Last allocated cluster (DWORD) */
190
191#define MBR_Table 446 /* MBR: Offset of partition table in the MBR */
192#define SZ_PTE 16 /* MBR: Size of a partition table entry */
193#define PTE_Boot 0 /* MBR PTE: Boot indicator */
194#define PTE_StHead 1 /* MBR PTE: Start head */
195#define PTE_StSec 2 /* MBR PTE: Start sector */
196#define PTE_StCyl 3 /* MBR PTE: Start cylinder */
197#define PTE_System 4 /* MBR PTE: System ID */
198#define PTE_EdHead 5 /* MBR PTE: End head */
199#define PTE_EdSec 6 /* MBR PTE: End sector */
200#define PTE_EdCyl 7 /* MBR PTE: End cylinder */
201#define PTE_StLba 8 /* MBR PTE: Start in LBA */
202#define PTE_SizLba 12 /* MBR PTE: Size in LBA */
203
204#define GPTH_Sign 0 /* GPT HDR: Signature (8-byte) */
205#define GPTH_Rev 8 /* GPT HDR: Revision (DWORD) */
206#define GPTH_Size 12 /* GPT HDR: Header size (DWORD) */
207#define GPTH_Bcc 16 /* GPT HDR: Header BCC (DWORD) */
208#define GPTH_CurLba 24 /* GPT HDR: This header LBA (QWORD) */
209#define GPTH_BakLba 32 /* GPT HDR: Another header LBA (QWORD) */
210#define GPTH_FstLba 40 /* GPT HDR: First LBA for partition data (QWORD) */
211#define GPTH_LstLba 48 /* GPT HDR: Last LBA for partition data (QWORD) */
212#define GPTH_DskGuid 56 /* GPT HDR: Disk GUID (16-byte) */
213#define GPTH_PtOfs 72 /* GPT HDR: Partition table LBA (QWORD) */
214#define GPTH_PtNum 80 /* GPT HDR: Number of table entries (DWORD) */
215#define GPTH_PteSize 84 /* GPT HDR: Size of table entry (DWORD) */
216#define GPTH_PtBcc 88 /* GPT HDR: Partition table BCC (DWORD) */
217#define SZ_GPTE 128 /* GPT PTE: Size of partition table entry */
218#define GPTE_PtGuid 0 /* GPT PTE: Partition type GUID (16-byte) */
219#define GPTE_UpGuid 16 /* GPT PTE: Partition unique GUID (16-byte) */
220#define GPTE_FstLba 32 /* GPT PTE: First LBA of partition (QWORD) */
221#define GPTE_LstLba 40 /* GPT PTE: Last LBA of partition (QWORD) */
222#define GPTE_Flags 48 /* GPT PTE: Partition flags (QWORD) */
223#define GPTE_Name 56 /* GPT PTE: Partition name */
224
225/* Post process on fatal error in the file operations */
226#define ABORT(fs, res) \
227 { \
228 fp->err = (BYTE)(res); \
229 LEAVE_FF(fs, res); \
230 }
231
232/* Re-entrancy related */
233#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
234#if FF_USE_LFN == 1
235#error Static LFN work area cannot be used in thread-safe configuration
236#endif
237#define LEAVE_FF(fs, res) \
238 { \
239 unlock_volume(fs, res); \
240 return res; \
241 }
242#else
243#define LEAVE_FF(fs, res) return res
244#endif
245
246/* Definitions of logical drive - physical location conversion */
247#if FF_MULTI_PARTITION
248#define LD2PD(vol) VolToPart[vol].pd /* Get physical drive number */
249#define LD2PT(vol) VolToPart[vol].pt /* Get partition number (0:auto search, 1..:forced partition number) */
250#else
251#define LD2PD(vol) (BYTE)(vol) /* Each logical drive is associated with the same physical drive number */
252#define LD2PT(vol) 0 /* Auto partition search */
253#endif
254
255/* Definitions of sector size */
256#if (FF_MAX_SS < FF_MIN_SS) || (FF_MAX_SS != 512 && FF_MAX_SS != 1024 && FF_MAX_SS != 2048 && FF_MAX_SS != 4096) || (FF_MIN_SS != 512 && FF_MIN_SS != 1024 && FF_MIN_SS != 2048 && FF_MIN_SS != 4096)
257#error Wrong sector size configuration
258#endif
259#if FF_MAX_SS == FF_MIN_SS
260#define SS(fs) ((UINT)FF_MAX_SS) /* Fixed sector size */
261#else
262#define SS(fs) ((fs)->ssize) /* Variable sector size */
263#endif
264
265/* Timestamp */
266#if FF_FS_NORTC == 1
267#if FF_NORTC_YEAR < 1980 || FF_NORTC_YEAR > 2107 || FF_NORTC_MON < 1 || FF_NORTC_MON > 12 || FF_NORTC_MDAY < 1 || FF_NORTC_MDAY > 31
268#error Invalid FF_FS_NORTC settings
269#endif
270#define GET_FATTIME() ((DWORD)(FF_NORTC_YEAR - 1980) << 25 | (DWORD)FF_NORTC_MON << 21 | (DWORD)FF_NORTC_MDAY << 16)
271#else
272#define GET_FATTIME() get_fattime()
273#endif
274
275/* File lock controls */
276#if FF_FS_LOCK
277#if FF_FS_READONLY
278#error FF_FS_LOCK must be 0 at read-only configuration
279#endif
280typedef struct {
281 FATFS* fs; /* Object ID 1, volume (NULL:blank entry) */
282 DWORD clu; /* Object ID 2, containing directory (0:root) */
283 DWORD ofs; /* Object ID 3, offset in the directory */
284 UINT ctr; /* Object open counter, 0:none, 0x01..0xFF:read mode open count, 0x100:write mode */
285} FILESEM;
286#endif
287
288/* SBCS up-case tables (\x80-\xFF) */
289#define TBL_CT437 \
290 {0x80, 0x9A, 0x45, 0x41, 0x8E, 0x41, 0x8F, 0x80, 0x45, 0x45, 0x45, 0x49, 0x49, 0x49, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x92, 0x92, 0x4F, 0x99, 0x4F, 0x55, 0x55, 0x59, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9B, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0x41, 0x49, 0x4F, 0x55, 0xA5, 0xA5, 0xA6, 0xA7, 0xA8, 0xA9, 0xAA, 0xAB, 0xAC, 0xAD, 0xAE, 0xAF, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD1, 0xD2, 0xD3, 0xD4, 0xD5, 0xD6, 0xD7, 0xD8, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDD, 0xDE, 0xDF, 0xE0, 0xE1, 0xE2, 0xE3, 0xE4, 0xE5, 0xE6, 0xE7, 0xE8, 0xE9, 0xEA, 0xEB, 0xEC, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF0, 0xF1, 0xF2, 0xF3, 0xF4, 0xF5, 0xF6, 0xF7, 0xF8, 0xF9, 0xFA, 0xFB, 0xFC, 0xFD, 0xFE, 0xFF}
291#define TBL_CT720 \
292 {0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x86, 0x87, 0x88, 0x89, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x91, 0x92, 0x93, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x98, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9B, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0xA0, 0xA1, 0xA2, 0xA3, 0xA4, 0xA5, 0xA6, 0xA7, 0xA8, 0xA9, 0xAA, 0xAB, 0xAC, 0xAD, 0xAE, 0xAF, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD1, 0xD2, 0xD3, 0xD4, 0xD5, 0xD6, 0xD7, 0xD8, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDD, 0xDE, 0xDF, 0xE0, 0xE1, 0xE2, 0xE3, 0xE4, 0xE5, 0xE6, 0xE7, 0xE8, 0xE9, 0xEA, 0xEB, 0xEC, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF0, 0xF1, 0xF2, 0xF3, 0xF4, 0xF5, 0xF6, 0xF7, 0xF8, 0xF9, 0xFA, 0xFB, 0xFC, 0xFD, 0xFE, 0xFF}
293#define TBL_CT737 \
294 {0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x86, 0x87, 0x88, 0x89, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x92, 0x92, 0x93, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x86, 0x87, 0x88, 0x89, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x91, 0xAA, 0x92, 0x93, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD1, 0xD2, 0xD3, 0xD4, 0xD5, 0xD6, 0xD7, 0xD8, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDD, 0xDE, 0xDF, 0x97, 0xEA, 0xEB, 0xEC, 0xE4, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF5, 0xF0, 0xEA, 0xEB, 0xEC, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF0, 0xF1, 0xF2, 0xF3, 0xF4, 0xF5, 0xF6, 0xF7, 0xF8, 0xF9, 0xFA, 0xFB, 0xFC, 0xFD, 0xFE, 0xFF}
295#define TBL_CT771 \
296 {0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x86, 0x87, 0x88, 0x89, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x91, 0x92, 0x93, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x98, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9B, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83, 0x84, 0x85, 0x86, 0x87, 0x88, 0x89, 0x8A, 0x8B, 0x8C, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD1, 0xD2, 0xD3, 0xD4, 0xD5, 0xD6, 0xD7, 0xD8, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDC, 0xDE, 0xDE, 0x90, 0x91, 0x92, 0x93, 0x94, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x98, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9B, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0xF0, 0xF0, 0xF2, 0xF2, 0xF4, 0xF4, 0xF6, 0xF6, 0xF8, 0xF8, 0xFA, 0xFA, 0xFC, 0xFC, 0xFE, 0xFF}
297#define TBL_CT775 \
298 {0x80, 0x9A, 0x91, 0xA0, 0x8E, 0x95, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xAD, 0xED, 0x8A, 0x8A, 0xA1, 0x8D, 0x8E, 0x8F, 0x90, 0x92, 0x92, 0xE2, 0x99, 0x95, 0x96, 0x97, 0x97, 0x99, 0x9A, 0x9D, 0x9C, 0x9D, 0x9E, 0x9F, 0xA0, 0xA1, 0xE0, 0xA3, 0xA3, 0xA5, 0xA6, 0xA7, 0xA8, 0xA9, 0xAA, 0xAB, 0xAC, 0xAD, 0xAE, 0xAF, 0xB0, 0xB1, 0xB2, 0xB3, 0xB4, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xB9, 0xBA, 0xBB, 0xBC, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xBF, 0xC0, 0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3, 0xC4, 0xC5, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xC8, 0xC9, 0xCA, 0xCB, 0xCC, 0xCD, 0xCE, 0xCF, 0xB5, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0xB8, 0xBD, 0xBE, 0xC6, 0xC7, 0xA5, 0xD9, 0xDA, 0xDB, 0xDC, 0xDD, 0xDE, 0xDF, 0xE0, 0xE1, 0xE2, 0xE3, 0xE5, 0xE5, 0xE6, 0xE3, 0xE8, 0xE8, 0xEA, 0xEA, 0xEE, 0xED, 0xEE, 0xEF, 0xF0, 0xF1, 0xF2, 0xF3, 0xF4, 0xF5, 0xF6, 0xF7, 0xF8, 0xF9, 0xFA, 0xFB, 0xFC, 0xFD, 0xFE, 0xFF}
299#define TBL_CT850 \

324/* DBCS code range |----- 1st byte -----| |----------- 2nd byte -----------| */
325/* <------> <------> <------> <------> <------> */
326#define TBL_DC932 \
327 {0x81, 0x9F, 0xE0, 0xFC, 0x40, 0x7E, 0x80, 0xFC, 0x00, 0x00}
328#define TBL_DC936 \
329 {0x81, 0xFE, 0x00, 0x00, 0x40, 0x7E, 0x80, 0xFE, 0x00, 0x00}
330#define TBL_DC949 \
331 {0x81, 0xFE, 0x00, 0x00, 0x41, 0x5A, 0x61, 0x7A, 0x81, 0xFE}
332#define TBL_DC950 \
333 {0x81, 0xFE, 0x00, 0x00, 0x40, 0x7E, 0xA1, 0xFE, 0x00, 0x00}
334
335/* Macros for table definitions */
336#define MERGE_2STR(a, b) a##b
337#define MKCVTBL(hd, cp) MERGE_2STR(hd, cp)
338
339/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------
340
341 Module Private Work Area
342
343---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
344/* Remark: Variables defined here without initial value shall be guaranteed
345/ zero/null at start-up. If not, the linker option or start-up routine is
346/ not compliance with C standard. */
347
348/*--------------------------------*/
349/* File/Volume controls */
350/*--------------------------------*/
351
352#if FF_VOLUMES < 1 || FF_VOLUMES > 10
353#error Wrong FF_VOLUMES setting
354#endif
355static FATFS* FatFs[FF_VOLUMES]; /* Pointer to the filesystem objects (logical drives) */
356static WORD Fsid; /* Filesystem mount ID */
357
358#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
359static BYTE CurrVol; /* Current drive set by f_chdrive() */
360#endif
361
362#if FF_FS_LOCK != 0
363static FILESEM Files[FF_FS_LOCK]; /* Open object lock semaphores */
364#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
365static BYTE SysLock; /* System lock flag (0:no mutex, 1:unlocked, 2:locked) */
366#endif
367#endif
368
369#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID
370#ifdef FF_VOLUME_STRS
371static const char* const VolumeStr[FF_VOLUMES] = {FF_VOLUME_STRS}; /* Pre-defined volume ID */
372#endif
373#endif
374
375#if FF_LBA64
376#if FF_MIN_GPT > 0x100000000
377#error Wrong FF_MIN_GPT setting
378#endif
379static const BYTE GUID_MS_Basic[16] = {0xA2, 0xA0, 0xD0, 0xEB, 0xE5, 0xB9, 0x33, 0x44, 0x87, 0xC0, 0x68, 0xB6, 0xB7, 0x26, 0x99, 0xC7};
380#endif
381
382/*--------------------------------*/
383/* LFN/Directory working buffer */
384/*--------------------------------*/
385
386#if FF_USE_LFN == 0 /* Non-LFN configuration */
387#if FF_FS_EXFAT
388#error LFN must be enabled when enable exFAT
389#endif
390#define DEF_NAMBUF
391#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs)
392#define FREE_NAMBUF()
393#define LEAVE_MKFS(res) return res
394
395#else /* LFN configurations */
396#if FF_MAX_LFN < 12 || FF_MAX_LFN > 255
397#error Wrong setting of FF_MAX_LFN
398#endif
399#if FF_LFN_BUF < FF_SFN_BUF || FF_SFN_BUF < 12
400#error Wrong setting of FF_LFN_BUF or FF_SFN_BUF
401#endif
402#if FF_LFN_UNICODE < 0 || FF_LFN_UNICODE > 3
403#error Wrong setting of FF_LFN_UNICODE
404#endif
405static const BYTE LfnOfs[] = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 14, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 28, 30}; /* FAT: Offset of LFN characters in the directory entry */
406#define MAXDIRB(nc) ((nc + 44U) / 15 * SZDIRE) /* exFAT: Size of directory entry block scratchpad buffer needed for the name length */
407
408#if FF_USE_LFN == 1 /* LFN enabled with static working buffer */
409#if FF_FS_EXFAT
410static BYTE DirBuf[MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN)]; /* Directory entry block scratchpad buffer */
411#endif
412static WCHAR LfnBuf[FF_MAX_LFN + 1]; /* LFN working buffer */
413#define DEF_NAMBUF
414#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs)
415#define FREE_NAMBUF()
416#define LEAVE_MKFS(res) return res
417
418#elif FF_USE_LFN == 2 /* LFN enabled with dynamic working buffer on the stack */
419#if FF_FS_EXFAT
420#define DEF_NAMBUF \
421 WCHAR lbuf[FF_MAX_LFN + 1]; \
422 BYTE dbuf[MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN)]; /* LFN working buffer and directory entry block scratchpad buffer */
423#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs) \
424 { \
425 (fs)->lfnbuf = lbuf; \
426 (fs)->dirbuf = dbuf; \
427 }
428#define FREE_NAMBUF()
429#else
430#define DEF_NAMBUF WCHAR lbuf[FF_MAX_LFN + 1]; /* LFN working buffer */
431#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs) \
432 { (fs)->lfnbuf = lbuf; }
433#define FREE_NAMBUF()
434#endif
435#define LEAVE_MKFS(res) return res
436
437#elif FF_USE_LFN == 3 /* LFN enabled with dynamic working buffer on the heap */
438#if FF_FS_EXFAT
439#define DEF_NAMBUF WCHAR* lfn; /* Pointer to LFN working buffer and directory entry block scratchpad buffer */
440#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs) \
441 { \
442 lfn = ff_memalloc((FF_MAX_LFN + 1) * 2 + MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN)); \
443 if (!lfn) \
444 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_NOT_ENOUGH_CORE); \
445 (fs)->lfnbuf = lfn; \
446 (fs)->dirbuf = (BYTE*)(lfn + FF_MAX_LFN + 1); \
447 }
448#define FREE_NAMBUF() ff_memfree(lfn)
449#else
450#define DEF_NAMBUF WCHAR* lfn; /* Pointer to LFN working buffer */
451#define INIT_NAMBUF(fs) \
452 { \
453 lfn = ff_memalloc((FF_MAX_LFN + 1) * 2); \
454 if (!lfn) \
455 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_NOT_ENOUGH_CORE); \
456 (fs)->lfnbuf = lfn; \
457 }
458#define FREE_NAMBUF() ff_memfree(lfn)
459#endif
460#define LEAVE_MKFS(res) \
461 { \
462 if (!work) \
463 ff_memfree(buf); \
464 return res; \
465 }
466#define MAX_MALLOC 0x8000 /* Must be >=FF_MAX_SS */
467
468#else
469#error Wrong setting of FF_USE_LFN
470
471#endif /* FF_USE_LFN == 1 */
472#endif /* FF_USE_LFN == 0 */
473
474/*--------------------------------*/
475/* Code conversion tables */
476/*--------------------------------*/
477
478#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0 /* Run-time code page configuration */
479#define CODEPAGE CodePage
480static WORD CodePage; /* Current code page */
481static const BYTE* ExCvt; /* Ptr to SBCS up-case table Ct???[] (null:not used) */
482static const BYTE* DbcTbl; /* Ptr to DBCS code range table Dc???[] (null:not used) */
483
484static const BYTE Ct437[] = TBL_CT437;
485static const BYTE Ct720[] = TBL_CT720;
486static const BYTE Ct737[] = TBL_CT737;
487static const BYTE Ct771[] = TBL_CT771;
488static const BYTE Ct775[] = TBL_CT775;
489static const BYTE Ct850[] = TBL_CT850;
490static const BYTE Ct852[] = TBL_CT852;
491static const BYTE Ct855[] = TBL_CT855;
492static const BYTE Ct857[] = TBL_CT857;
493static const BYTE Ct860[] = TBL_CT860;
494static const BYTE Ct861[] = TBL_CT861;
495static const BYTE Ct862[] = TBL_CT862;
496static const BYTE Ct863[] = TBL_CT863;
497static const BYTE Ct864[] = TBL_CT864;
498static const BYTE Ct865[] = TBL_CT865;
499static const BYTE Ct866[] = TBL_CT866;
500static const BYTE Ct869[] = TBL_CT869;
501static const BYTE Dc932[] = TBL_DC932;
502static const BYTE Dc936[] = TBL_DC936;
503static const BYTE Dc949[] = TBL_DC949;
504static const BYTE Dc950[] = TBL_DC950;
505
506#elif FF_CODE_PAGE < 900 /* Static code page configuration (SBCS) */
507#define CODEPAGE FF_CODE_PAGE
508static const BYTE ExCvt[] = MKCVTBL(TBL_CT, FF_CODE_PAGE);
509
510#else /* Static code page configuration (DBCS) */
511#define CODEPAGE FF_CODE_PAGE
512static const BYTE DbcTbl[] = MKCVTBL(TBL_DC, FF_CODE_PAGE);
513
514#endif
515
516/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------
517
518 Module Private Functions
519
520---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
521
522/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
523/* Load/Store multi-byte word in the FAT structure */
524/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
525
526static WORD ld_word(const BYTE* ptr) /* Load a 2-byte little-endian word */
527{
528 WORD rv;
529
530 rv = ptr[1];
531 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[0];
532 return rv;
533}
534
535static DWORD ld_dword(const BYTE* ptr) /* Load a 4-byte little-endian word */
536{
537 DWORD rv;
538
539 rv = ptr[3];
540 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[2];
541 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[1];
542 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[0];
543 return rv;
544}
545
546#if FF_FS_EXFAT
547static QWORD ld_qword(const BYTE* ptr) /* Load an 8-byte little-endian word */
548{
549 QWORD rv;
550
551 rv = ptr[7];
552 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[6];
553 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[5];
554 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[4];
555 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[3];
556 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[2];
557 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[1];
558 rv = rv << 8 | ptr[0];
559 return rv;
560}
561#endif
562
563#if !FF_FS_READONLY
564static void st_word(BYTE* ptr, WORD val) /* Store a 2-byte word in little-endian */
565{
566 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
567 val >>= 8;
568 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
569}
570
571static void st_dword(BYTE* ptr, DWORD val) /* Store a 4-byte word in little-endian */
572{
573 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
574 val >>= 8;
575 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
576 val >>= 8;
577 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
578 val >>= 8;
579 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
580}
581
582#if FF_FS_EXFAT
583static void st_qword(BYTE* ptr, QWORD val) /* Store an 8-byte word in little-endian */
584{
585 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
586 val >>= 8;
587 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
588 val >>= 8;
589 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
590 val >>= 8;
591 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
592 val >>= 8;
593 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
594 val >>= 8;
595 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
596 val >>= 8;
597 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
598 val >>= 8;
599 *ptr++ = (BYTE)val;
600}
601#endif
602#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
603
604/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
605/* String functions */
606/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
607
608/* Test if the byte is DBC 1st byte */
609static int dbc_1st(BYTE c) {
610#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0 /* Variable code page */
611 if (DbcTbl && c >= DbcTbl[0]) {
612 if (c <= DbcTbl[1])
613 return 1; /* 1st byte range 1 */
614 if (c >= DbcTbl[2] && c <= DbcTbl[3])
615 return 1; /* 1st byte range 2 */
616 }
617#elif FF_CODE_PAGE >= 900 /* DBCS fixed code page */
618 if (c >= DbcTbl[0]) {
619 if (c <= DbcTbl[1])
620 return 1;
621 if (c >= DbcTbl[2] && c <= DbcTbl[3])
622 return 1;
623 }
624#else /* SBCS fixed code page */
625 if (c != 0)
626 return 0; /* Always false */
627#endif
628 return 0;
629}
630
631/* Test if the byte is DBC 2nd byte */
632static int dbc_2nd(BYTE c) {
633#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0 /* Variable code page */
634 if (DbcTbl && c >= DbcTbl[4]) {
635 if (c <= DbcTbl[5])
636 return 1; /* 2nd byte range 1 */
637 if (c >= DbcTbl[6] && c <= DbcTbl[7])
638 return 1; /* 2nd byte range 2 */
639 if (c >= DbcTbl[8] && c <= DbcTbl[9])
640 return 1; /* 2nd byte range 3 */
641 }
642#elif FF_CODE_PAGE >= 900 /* DBCS fixed code page */
643 if (c >= DbcTbl[4]) {
644 if (c <= DbcTbl[5])
645 return 1;
646 if (c >= DbcTbl[6] && c <= DbcTbl[7])
647 return 1;
648 if (c >= DbcTbl[8] && c <= DbcTbl[9])
649 return 1;
650 }
651#else /* SBCS fixed code page */
652 if (c != 0)
653 return 0; /* Always false */
654#endif
655 return 0;
656}
657
658#if FF_USE_LFN
659
660/* Get a Unicode code point from the TCHAR string in defined API encodeing */
661static DWORD tchar2uni(/* Returns a character in UTF-16 encoding (>=0x10000 on surrogate pair, 0xFFFFFFFF on decode error) */
662 const TCHAR** str /* Pointer to pointer to TCHAR string in configured encoding */
663) {
664 DWORD uc;
665 const TCHAR* p = *str;
666
667#if FF_LFN_UNICODE == 1 /* UTF-16 input */
668 WCHAR wc;
669
670 uc = *p++; /* Get a unit */
671 if (IsSurrogate(uc)) { /* Surrogate? */
672 wc = *p++; /* Get low surrogate */
673 if (!IsSurrogateH(uc) || !IsSurrogateL(wc))
674 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Wrong surrogate? */
675 uc = uc << 16 | wc;
676 }
677
678#elif FF_LFN_UNICODE == 2 /* UTF-8 input */
679 BYTE b;
680 int nf;
681
682 uc = (BYTE)*p++; /* Get an encoding unit */
683 if (uc & 0x80) { /* Multiple byte code? */
684 if ((uc & 0xE0) == 0xC0) { /* 2-byte sequence? */
685 uc &= 0x1F;
686 nf = 1;
687 } else if ((uc & 0xF0) == 0xE0) { /* 3-byte sequence? */
688 uc &= 0x0F;
689 nf = 2;
690 } else if ((uc & 0xF8) == 0xF0) { /* 4-byte sequence? */
691 uc &= 0x07;
692 nf = 3;
693 } else { /* Wrong sequence */
694 return 0xFFFFFFFF;
695 }
696 do { /* Get trailing bytes */
697 b = (BYTE)*p++;
698 if ((b & 0xC0) != 0x80)
699 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Wrong sequence? */
700 uc = uc << 6 | (b & 0x3F);
701 } while (--nf != 0);
702 if (uc < 0x80 || IsSurrogate(uc) || uc >= 0x110000)
703 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Wrong code? */
704 if (uc >= 0x010000)
705 uc = 0xD800DC00 | ((uc - 0x10000) << 6 & 0x3FF0000) | (uc & 0x3FF); /* Make a surrogate pair if needed */
706 }
707
708#elif FF_LFN_UNICODE == 3 /* UTF-32 input */
709 uc = (TCHAR)*p++; /* Get a unit */
710 if (uc >= 0x110000 || IsSurrogate(uc))
711 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Wrong code? */
712 if (uc >= 0x010000)
713 uc = 0xD800DC00 | ((uc - 0x10000) << 6 & 0x3FF0000) | (uc & 0x3FF); /* Make a surrogate pair if needed */
714
715#else /* ANSI/OEM input */
716 BYTE b;
717 WCHAR wc;
718
719 wc = (BYTE)*p++; /* Get a byte */
720 if (dbc_1st((BYTE)wc)) { /* Is it a DBC 1st byte? */
721 b = (BYTE)*p++; /* Get 2nd byte */
722 if (!dbc_2nd(b))
723 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Invalid code? */
724 wc = (wc << 8) + b; /* Make a DBC */
725 }
726 if (wc != 0) {
727 wc = ff_oem2uni(wc, CODEPAGE); /* ANSI/OEM ==> Unicode */
728 if (wc == 0)
729 return 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Invalid code? */
730 }
731 uc = wc;
732
733#endif
734 *str = p; /* Next read pointer */
735 return uc;
736}
737
738/* Store a Unicode char in defined API encoding */
739static UINT put_utf(/* Returns number of encoding units written (0:buffer overflow or wrong encoding) */
740 DWORD chr, /* UTF-16 encoded character (Surrogate pair if >=0x10000) */
741 TCHAR* buf, /* Output buffer */
742 UINT szb /* Size of the buffer */
743) {
744#if FF_LFN_UNICODE == 1 /* UTF-16 output */
745 WCHAR hs, wc;
746
747 hs = (WCHAR)(chr >> 16);
748 wc = (WCHAR)chr;
749 if (hs == 0) { /* Single encoding unit? */
750 if (szb < 1 || IsSurrogate(wc))
751 return 0; /* Buffer overflow or wrong code? */
752 *buf = wc;
753 return 1;
754 }
755 if (szb < 2 || !IsSurrogateH(hs) || !IsSurrogateL(wc))
756 return 0; /* Buffer overflow or wrong surrogate? */
757 *buf++ = hs;
758 *buf++ = wc;
759 return 2;
760
761#elif FF_LFN_UNICODE == 2 /* UTF-8 output */
762 DWORD hc;
763
764 if (chr < 0x80) { /* Single byte code? */
765 if (szb < 1)
766 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
767 *buf = (TCHAR)chr;
768 return 1;
769 }
770 if (chr < 0x800) { /* 2-byte sequence? */
771 if (szb < 2)
772 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
773 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0xC0 | (chr >> 6 & 0x1F));
774 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 0 & 0x3F));
775 return 2;
776 }
777 if (chr < 0x10000) { /* 3-byte sequence? */
778 if (szb < 3 || IsSurrogate(chr))
779 return 0; /* Buffer overflow or wrong code? */
780 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0xE0 | (chr >> 12 & 0x0F));
781 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 6 & 0x3F));
782 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 0 & 0x3F));
783 return 3;
784 }
785 /* 4-byte sequence */
786 if (szb < 4)
787 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
788 hc = ((chr & 0xFFFF0000) - 0xD8000000) >> 6; /* Get high 10 bits */
789 chr = (chr & 0xFFFF) - 0xDC00; /* Get low 10 bits */
790 if (hc >= 0x100000 || chr >= 0x400)
791 return 0; /* Wrong surrogate? */
792 chr = (hc | chr) + 0x10000;
793 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0xF0 | (chr >> 18 & 0x07));
794 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 12 & 0x3F));
795 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 6 & 0x3F));
796 *buf++ = (TCHAR)(0x80 | (chr >> 0 & 0x3F));
797 return 4;
798
799#elif FF_LFN_UNICODE == 3 /* UTF-32 output */
800 DWORD hc;
801
802 if (szb < 1)
803 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
804 if (chr >= 0x10000) { /* Out of BMP? */
805 hc = ((chr & 0xFFFF0000) - 0xD8000000) >> 6; /* Get high 10 bits */
806 chr = (chr & 0xFFFF) - 0xDC00; /* Get low 10 bits */
807 if (hc >= 0x100000 || chr >= 0x400)
808 return 0; /* Wrong surrogate? */
809 chr = (hc | chr) + 0x10000;
810 }
811 *buf++ = (TCHAR)chr;
812 return 1;
813
814#else /* ANSI/OEM output */
815 WCHAR wc;
816
817 wc = ff_uni2oem(chr, CODEPAGE);
818 if (wc >= 0x100) { /* Is this a DBC? */
819 if (szb < 2)
820 return 0;
821 *buf++ = (char)(wc >> 8); /* Store DBC 1st byte */
822 *buf++ = (TCHAR)wc; /* Store DBC 2nd byte */
823 return 2;
824 }
825 if (wc == 0 || szb < 1)
826 return 0; /* Invalid char or buffer overflow? */
827 *buf++ = (TCHAR)wc; /* Store the character */
828 return 1;
829#endif
830}
831#endif /* FF_USE_LFN */
832
833#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
834/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
835/* Request/Release grant to access the volume */
836/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
837
838static int lock_volume(/* 1:Ok, 0:timeout */
839 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object to lock */
840 int syslock /* System lock required */
841) {
842 int rv;
843
844#if FF_FS_LOCK
845 rv = ff_mutex_take(fs->ldrv); /* Lock the volume */
846 if (rv && syslock) { /* System lock reqiered? */
847 rv = ff_mutex_take(FF_VOLUMES); /* Lock the system */
848 if (rv) {
849 SysLock = 2; /* System lock succeeded */
850 } else {
851 ff_mutex_give(fs->ldrv); /* Failed system lock */
852 }
853 }
854#else
855 rv = syslock ? ff_mutex_take(fs->ldrv) : ff_mutex_take(fs->ldrv); /* Lock the volume (this is to prevent compiler warning) */
856#endif
857 return rv;
858}
859
860static void unlock_volume(
861 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
862 FRESULT res /* Result code to be returned */
863) {
864 if (fs && res != FR_NOT_ENABLED && res != FR_INVALID_DRIVE && res != FR_TIMEOUT) {
865#if FF_FS_LOCK
866 if (SysLock == 2) { /* Is the system locked? */
867 SysLock = 1;
868 ff_mutex_give(FF_VOLUMES);
869 }
870#endif
871 ff_mutex_give(fs->ldrv); /* Unlock the volume */
872 }
873}
874
875#endif
876
877#if FF_FS_LOCK
878/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
879/* File shareing control functions */
880/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
881
882static FRESULT chk_share(/* Check if the file can be accessed */
883 DIR* dp, /* Directory object pointing the file to be checked */
884 int acc /* Desired access type (0:Read mode open, 1:Write mode open, 2:Delete or rename) */
885) {
886 UINT i, be;
887
888 /* Search open object table for the object */
889 be = 0;
890 for (i = 0; i < FF_FS_LOCK; i++) {
891 if (Files[i].fs) { /* Existing entry */
892 if (Files[i].fs == dp->obj.fs && /* Check if the object matches with an open object */
893 Files[i].clu == dp->obj.sclust && Files[i].ofs == dp->dptr)
894 break;
895 } else { /* Blank entry */
896 be = 1;
897 }
898 }
899 if (i == FF_FS_LOCK) { /* The object has not been opened */
900 return (!be && acc != 2) ? FR_TOO_MANY_OPEN_FILES : FR_OK; /* Is there a blank entry for new object? */
901 }
902
903 /* The object was opened. Reject any open against writing file and all write mode open */
904 return (acc != 0 || Files[i].ctr == 0x100) ? FR_LOCKED : FR_OK;
905}
906
907static int enq_share(void) /* Check if an entry is available for a new object */
908{
909 UINT i;
910
911 for (i = 0; i < FF_FS_LOCK && Files[i].fs; i++)
912 ; /* Find a free entry */
913 return (i == FF_FS_LOCK) ? 0 : 1;
914}
915
916static UINT inc_share(/* Increment object open counter and returns its index (0:Internal error) */
917 DIR* dp, /* Directory object pointing the file to register or increment */
918 int acc /* Desired access (0:Read, 1:Write, 2:Delete/Rename) */
919) {
920 UINT i;
921
922 for (i = 0; i < FF_FS_LOCK; i++) { /* Find the object */
923 if (Files[i].fs == dp->obj.fs
924 && Files[i].clu == dp->obj.sclust
925 && Files[i].ofs == dp->dptr)
926 break;
927 }
928
929 if (i == FF_FS_LOCK) { /* Not opened. Register it as new. */
930 for (i = 0; i < FF_FS_LOCK && Files[i].fs; i++)
931 ; /* Find a free entry */
932 if (i == FF_FS_LOCK)
933 return 0; /* No free entry to register (int err) */
934 Files[i].fs = dp->obj.fs;
935 Files[i].clu = dp->obj.sclust;
936 Files[i].ofs = dp->dptr;
937 Files[i].ctr = 0;
938 }
939
940 if (acc >= 1 && Files[i].ctr)
941 return 0; /* Access violation (int err) */
942
943 Files[i].ctr = acc ? 0x100 : Files[i].ctr + 1; /* Set semaphore value */
944
945 return i + 1; /* Index number origin from 1 */
946}
947
948static FRESULT dec_share(/* Decrement object open counter */
949 UINT i /* Semaphore index (1..) */
950) {
951 UINT n;
952 FRESULT res;
953
954 if (--i < FF_FS_LOCK) { /* Index number origin from 0 */
955 n = Files[i].ctr;
956 if (n == 0x100)
957 n = 0; /* If write mode open, delete the object semaphore */
958 if (n > 0)
959 n--; /* Decrement read mode open count */
960 Files[i].ctr = n;
961 if (n == 0) { /* Delete the object semaphore if open count becomes zero */
962 Files[i].fs = 0; /* Free the entry <<<If this memory write operation is not in atomic, FF_FS_REENTRANT == 1 and FF_VOLUMES > 1, there is a potential error in this process >>> */
963 }
964 res = FR_OK;
965 } else {
966 res = FR_INT_ERR; /* Invalid index number */
967 }
968 return res;
969}
970
971static void clear_share(/* Clear all lock entries of the volume */
972 FATFS* fs) {
973 UINT i;
974
975 for (i = 0; i < FF_FS_LOCK; i++) {
976 if (Files[i].fs == fs)
977 Files[i].fs = 0;
978 }
979}
980
981#endif /* FF_FS_LOCK */
982
983/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
984/* Move/Flush disk access window in the filesystem object */
985/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
986#if !FF_FS_READONLY
987static FRESULT sync_window(/* Returns FR_OK or FR_DISK_ERR */
988 FATFS* fs /* Filesystem object */
989) {
990 FRESULT res = FR_OK;
991
992 if (fs->wflag) { /* Is the disk access window dirty? */
993 if (disk_write(fs->pdrv, fs->win, fs->winsect, 1) == RES_OK) { /* Write it back into the volume */
994 fs->wflag = 0; /* Clear window dirty flag */
995 if (fs->winsect - fs->fatbase < fs->fsize) { /* Is it in the 1st FAT? */
996 if (fs->n_fats == 2)
997 disk_write(fs->pdrv, fs->win, fs->winsect + fs->fsize, 1); /* Reflect it to 2nd FAT if needed */
998 }
999 } else {
1000 res = FR_DISK_ERR;
1001 }
1002 }
1003 return res;
1004}
1005#endif
1006
1007static FRESULT move_window(/* Returns FR_OK or FR_DISK_ERR */
1008 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
1009 LBA_t sect /* Sector LBA to make appearance in the fs->win[] */
1010) {
1011 FRESULT res = FR_OK;
1012
1013 if (sect != fs->winsect) { /* Window offset changed? */
1014#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1015 res = sync_window(fs); /* Flush the window */
1016#endif
1017 if (res == FR_OK) { /* Fill sector window with new data */
1018 if (disk_read(fs->pdrv, fs->win, sect, 1) != RES_OK) {
1019 sect = (LBA_t)0 - 1; /* Invalidate window if read data is not valid */
1020 res = FR_DISK_ERR;
1021 }
1022 fs->winsect = sect;
1023 }
1024 }
1025 return res;
1026}
1027
1028#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1029/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1030/* Synchronize filesystem and data on the storage */
1031/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1032
1033static FRESULT sync_fs(/* Returns FR_OK or FR_DISK_ERR */
1034 FATFS* fs /* Filesystem object */
1035) {
1036 FRESULT res;
1037
1038 res = sync_window(fs);
1039 if (res == FR_OK) {
1040 if (fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32 && fs->fsi_flag == 1) { /* FAT32: Update FSInfo sector if needed */
1041 /* Create FSInfo structure */
1042 memset(fs->win, 0, sizeof fs->win);
1043 st_word(fs->win + BS_55AA, 0xAA55); /* Boot signature */
1044 st_dword(fs->win + FSI_LeadSig, 0x41615252); /* Leading signature */
1045 st_dword(fs->win + FSI_StrucSig, 0x61417272); /* Structure signature */
1046 st_dword(fs->win + FSI_Free_Count, fs->free_clst); /* Number of free clusters */
1047 st_dword(fs->win + FSI_Nxt_Free, fs->last_clst); /* Last allocated culuster */
1048 fs->winsect = fs->volbase + 1; /* Write it into the FSInfo sector (Next to VBR) */
1049 disk_write(fs->pdrv, fs->win, fs->winsect, 1);
1050 fs->fsi_flag = 0;
1051 }
1052 /* Make sure that no pending write process in the lower layer */
1053 if (disk_ioctl(fs->pdrv, CTRL_SYNC, 0) != RES_OK)
1054 res = FR_DISK_ERR;
1055 }
1056
1057 return res;
1058}
1059
1060#endif
1061
1062/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1063/* Get physical sector number from cluster number */
1064/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1065
1066static LBA_t clst2sect(/* !=0:Sector number, 0:Failed (invalid cluster#) */
1067 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
1068 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to be converted */
1069) {
1070 clst -= 2; /* Cluster number is origin from 2 */
1071 if (clst >= fs->n_fatent - 2)
1072 return 0; /* Is it invalid cluster number? */
1073 return fs->database + (LBA_t)fs->csize * clst; /* Start sector number of the cluster */
1074}
1075
1076/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1077/* FAT access - Read value of an FAT entry */
1078/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1079
1080static DWORD get_fat(/* 0xFFFFFFFF:Disk error, 1:Internal error, 2..0x7FFFFFFF:Cluster status */
1081 FFOBJID* obj, /* Corresponding object */
1082 DWORD clst /* Cluster number to get the value */
1083) {
1084 UINT wc, bc;
1085 DWORD val;
1086 FATFS* fs = obj->fs;
1087
1088 if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent) { /* Check if in valid range */
1089 val = 1; /* Internal error */
1090
1091 } else {
1092 val = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Default value falls on disk error */
1093
1094 switch (fs->fs_type) {
1095 case FS_FAT12:
1096 bc = (UINT)clst;
1097 bc += bc / 2;
1098 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs))) != FR_OK)
1099 break;
1100 wc = fs->win[bc++ % SS(fs)]; /* Get 1st byte of the entry */
1101 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs))) != FR_OK)
1102 break;
1103 wc |= fs->win[bc % SS(fs)] << 8; /* Merge 2nd byte of the entry */
1104 val = (clst & 1) ? (wc >> 4) : (wc & 0xFFF); /* Adjust bit position */
1105 break;
1106
1107 case FS_FAT16:
1108 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 2))) != FR_OK)
1109 break;
1110 val = ld_word(fs->win + clst * 2 % SS(fs)); /* Simple WORD array */
1111 break;
1112
1113 case FS_FAT32:
1114 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 4))) != FR_OK)
1115 break;
1116 val = ld_dword(fs->win + clst * 4 % SS(fs)) & 0x0FFFFFFF; /* Simple DWORD array but mask out upper 4 bits */
1117 break;
1118#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1119 case FS_EXFAT:
1120 if ((obj->objsize != 0 && obj->sclust != 0) || obj->stat == 0) { /* Object except root dir must have valid data length */
1121 DWORD cofs = clst - obj->sclust; /* Offset from start cluster */
1122 DWORD clen = (DWORD)((LBA_t)((obj->objsize - 1) / SS(fs)) / fs->csize); /* Number of clusters - 1 */
1123
1124 if (obj->stat == 2 && cofs <= clen) { /* Is it a contiguous chain? */
1125 val = (cofs == clen) ? 0x7FFFFFFF : clst + 1; /* No data on the FAT, generate the value */
1126 break;
1127 }
1128 if (obj->stat == 3 && cofs < obj->n_cont) { /* Is it in the 1st fragment? */
1129 val = clst + 1; /* Generate the value */
1130 break;
1131 }
1132 if (obj->stat != 2) { /* Get value from FAT if FAT chain is valid */
1133 if (obj->n_frag != 0) { /* Is it on the growing edge? */
1134 val = 0x7FFFFFFF; /* Generate EOC */
1135 } else {
1136 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 4))) != FR_OK)
1137 break;
1138 val = ld_dword(fs->win + clst * 4 % SS(fs)) & 0x7FFFFFFF;
1139 }
1140 break;
1141 }
1142 }
1143 val = 1; /* Internal error */
1144 break;
1145#endif
1146 default:
1147 val = 1; /* Internal error */
1148 }
1149 }
1150
1151 return val;
1152}
1153
1154#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1155/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1156/* FAT access - Change value of an FAT entry */
1157/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1158
1159static FRESULT put_fat(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, !=0:error */
1160 FATFS* fs, /* Corresponding filesystem object */
1161 DWORD clst, /* FAT index number (cluster number) to be changed */
1162 DWORD val /* New value to be set to the entry */
1163) {
1164 UINT bc;
1165 BYTE* p;
1166 FRESULT res = FR_INT_ERR;
1167
1168 if (clst >= 2 && clst < fs->n_fatent) { /* Check if in valid range */
1169 switch (fs->fs_type) {
1170 case FS_FAT12:
1171 bc = (UINT)clst;
1172 bc += bc / 2; /* bc: byte offset of the entry */
1173 res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)));
1174 if (res != FR_OK)
1175 break;
1176 p = fs->win + bc++ % SS(fs);
1177 *p = (clst & 1) ? ((*p & 0x0F) | ((BYTE)val << 4)) : (BYTE)val; /* Update 1st byte */
1178 fs->wflag = 1;
1179 res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (bc / SS(fs)));
1180 if (res != FR_OK)
1181 break;
1182 p = fs->win + bc % SS(fs);
1183 *p = (clst & 1) ? (BYTE)(val >> 4) : ((*p & 0xF0) | ((BYTE)(val >> 8) & 0x0F)); /* Update 2nd byte */
1184 fs->wflag = 1;
1185 break;
1186
1187 case FS_FAT16:
1188 res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 2)));
1189 if (res != FR_OK)
1190 break;
1191 st_word(fs->win + clst * 2 % SS(fs), (WORD)val); /* Simple WORD array */
1192 fs->wflag = 1;
1193 break;
1194
1195 case FS_FAT32:
1196#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1197 case FS_EXFAT:
1198#endif
1199 res = move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + (clst / (SS(fs) / 4)));
1200 if (res != FR_OK)
1201 break;
1202 if (!FF_FS_EXFAT || fs->fs_type != FS_EXFAT) {
1203 val = (val & 0x0FFFFFFF) | (ld_dword(fs->win + clst * 4 % SS(fs)) & 0xF0000000);
1204 }
1205 st_dword(fs->win + clst * 4 % SS(fs), val);
1206 fs->wflag = 1;
1207 break;
1208 }
1209 }
1210 return res;
1211}
1212
1213#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
1214
1215#if FF_FS_EXFAT && !FF_FS_READONLY
1216/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1217/* exFAT: Accessing FAT and Allocation Bitmap */
1218/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1219
1220/*--------------------------------------*/
1221/* Find a contiguous free cluster block */
1222/*--------------------------------------*/
1223
1224static DWORD find_bitmap(/* 0:Not found, 2..:Cluster block found, 0xFFFFFFFF:Disk error */
1225 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
1226 DWORD clst, /* Cluster number to scan from */
1227 DWORD ncl /* Number of contiguous clusters to find (1..) */
1228) {
1229 BYTE bm, bv;
1230 UINT i;
1231 DWORD val, scl, ctr;
1232
1233 clst -= 2; /* The first bit in the bitmap corresponds to cluster #2 */
1234 if (clst >= fs->n_fatent - 2)
1235 clst = 0;
1236 scl = val = clst;
1237 ctr = 0;
1238 for (;;) {
1239 if (move_window(fs, fs->bitbase + val / 8 / SS(fs)) != FR_OK)
1240 return 0xFFFFFFFF;
1241 i = val / 8 % SS(fs);
1242 bm = 1 << (val % 8);
1243 do {
1244 do {
1245 bv = fs->win[i] & bm;
1246 bm <<= 1; /* Get bit value */
1247 if (++val >= fs->n_fatent - 2) { /* Next cluster (with wrap-around) */
1248 val = 0;
1249 bm = 0;
1250 i = SS(fs);
1251 }
1252 if (bv == 0) { /* Is it a free cluster? */
1253 if (++ctr == ncl)
1254 return scl + 2; /* Check if run length is sufficient for required */
1255 } else {
1256 scl = val;
1257 ctr = 0; /* Encountered a cluster in-use, restart to scan */
1258 }
1259 if (val == clst)
1260 return 0; /* All cluster scanned? */
1261 } while (bm != 0);
1262 bm = 1;
1263 } while (++i < SS(fs));
1264 }
1265}
1266
1267/*----------------------------------------*/
1268/* Set/Clear a block of allocation bitmap */
1269/*----------------------------------------*/
1270
1271static FRESULT change_bitmap(
1272 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
1273 DWORD clst, /* Cluster number to change from */
1274 DWORD ncl, /* Number of clusters to be changed */
1275 int bv /* bit value to be set (0 or 1) */
1276) {
1277 BYTE bm;
1278 UINT i;
1279 LBA_t sect;
1280
1281 clst -= 2; /* The first bit corresponds to cluster #2 */
1282 sect = fs->bitbase + clst / 8 / SS(fs); /* Sector address */
1283 i = clst / 8 % SS(fs); /* Byte offset in the sector */
1284 bm = 1 << (clst % 8); /* Bit mask in the byte */
1285 for (;;) {
1286 if (move_window(fs, sect++) != FR_OK)
1287 return FR_DISK_ERR;
1288 do {
1289 do {
1290 if (bv == (int)((fs->win[i] & bm) != 0))
1291 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Is the bit expected value? */
1292 fs->win[i] ^= bm; /* Flip the bit */
1293 fs->wflag = 1;
1294 if (--ncl == 0)
1295 return FR_OK; /* All bits processed? */
1296 } while (bm <<= 1); /* Next bit */
1297 bm = 1;
1298 } while (++i < SS(fs)); /* Next byte */
1299 i = 0;
1300 }
1301}
1302
1303/*---------------------------------------------*/
1304/* Fill the first fragment of the FAT chain */
1305/*---------------------------------------------*/
1306
1307static FRESULT fill_first_frag(
1308 FFOBJID* obj /* Pointer to the corresponding object */
1309) {
1310 FRESULT res;
1311 DWORD cl, n;
1312
1313 if (obj->stat == 3) { /* Has the object been changed 'fragmented' in this session? */
1314 for (cl = obj->sclust, n = obj->n_cont; n; cl++, n--) { /* Create cluster chain on the FAT */
1315 res = put_fat(obj->fs, cl, cl + 1);
1316 if (res != FR_OK)
1317 return res;
1318 }
1319 obj->stat = 0; /* Change status 'FAT chain is valid' */
1320 }
1321 return FR_OK;
1322}
1323
1324/*---------------------------------------------*/
1325/* Fill the last fragment of the FAT chain */
1326/*---------------------------------------------*/
1327
1328static FRESULT fill_last_frag(
1329 FFOBJID* obj, /* Pointer to the corresponding object */
1330 DWORD lcl, /* Last cluster of the fragment */
1331 DWORD term /* Value to set the last FAT entry */
1332) {
1333 FRESULT res;
1334
1335 while (obj->n_frag > 0) { /* Create the chain of last fragment */
1336 res = put_fat(obj->fs, lcl - obj->n_frag + 1, (obj->n_frag > 1) ? lcl - obj->n_frag + 2 : term);
1337 if (res != FR_OK)
1338 return res;
1339 obj->n_frag--;
1340 }
1341 return FR_OK;
1342}
1343
1344#endif /* FF_FS_EXFAT && !FF_FS_READONLY */
1345
1346#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1347/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1348/* FAT handling - Remove a cluster chain */
1349/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1350
1351static FRESULT remove_chain(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, !=0:error */
1352 FFOBJID* obj, /* Corresponding object */
1353 DWORD clst, /* Cluster to remove a chain from */
1354 DWORD pclst /* Previous cluster of clst (0 if entire chain) */
1355) {
1356 FRESULT res = FR_OK;
1357 DWORD nxt;
1358 FATFS* fs = obj->fs;
1359#if FF_FS_EXFAT || FF_USE_TRIM
1360 DWORD scl = clst, ecl = clst;
1361#endif
1362#if FF_USE_TRIM
1363 LBA_t rt[2];
1364#endif
1365
1366 if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent)
1367 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Check if in valid range */
1368
1369 /* Mark the previous cluster 'EOC' on the FAT if it exists */
1370 if (pclst != 0 && (!FF_FS_EXFAT || fs->fs_type != FS_EXFAT || obj->stat != 2)) {
1371 res = put_fat(fs, pclst, 0xFFFFFFFF);
1372 if (res != FR_OK)
1373 return res;
1374 }
1375
1376 /* Remove the chain */
1377 do {
1378 nxt = get_fat(obj, clst); /* Get cluster status */
1379 if (nxt == 0)
1380 break; /* Empty cluster? */
1381 if (nxt == 1)
1382 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Internal error? */
1383 if (nxt == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1384 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Disk error? */
1385 if (!FF_FS_EXFAT || fs->fs_type != FS_EXFAT) {
1386 res = put_fat(fs, clst, 0); /* Mark the cluster 'free' on the FAT */
1387 if (res != FR_OK)
1388 return res;
1389 }
1390 if (fs->free_clst < fs->n_fatent - 2) { /* Update FSINFO */
1391 fs->free_clst++;
1392 fs->fsi_flag |= 1;
1393 }
1394#if FF_FS_EXFAT || FF_USE_TRIM
1395 if (ecl + 1 == nxt) { /* Is next cluster contiguous? */
1396 ecl = nxt;
1397 } else { /* End of contiguous cluster block */
1398#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1399 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
1400 res = change_bitmap(fs, scl, ecl - scl + 1, 0); /* Mark the cluster block 'free' on the bitmap */
1401 if (res != FR_OK)
1402 return res;
1403 }
1404#endif
1405#if FF_USE_TRIM
1406 rt[0] = clst2sect(fs, scl); /* Start of data area to be freed */
1407 rt[1] = clst2sect(fs, ecl) + fs->csize - 1; /* End of data area to be freed */
1408 disk_ioctl(fs->pdrv, CTRL_TRIM, rt); /* Inform storage device that the data in the block may be erased */
1409#endif
1410 scl = ecl = nxt;
1411 }
1412#endif
1413 clst = nxt; /* Next cluster */
1414 } while (clst < fs->n_fatent); /* Repeat while not the last link */
1415
1416#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1417 /* Some post processes for chain status */
1418 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
1419 if (pclst == 0) { /* Has the entire chain been removed? */
1420 obj->stat = 0; /* Change the chain status 'initial' */
1421 } else {
1422 if (obj->stat == 0) { /* Is it a fragmented chain from the beginning of this session? */
1423 clst = obj->sclust; /* Follow the chain to check if it gets contiguous */
1424 while (clst != pclst) {
1425 nxt = get_fat(obj, clst);
1426 if (nxt < 2)
1427 return FR_INT_ERR;
1428 if (nxt == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1429 return FR_DISK_ERR;
1430 if (nxt != clst + 1)
1431 break; /* Not contiguous? */
1432 clst++;
1433 }
1434 if (clst == pclst) { /* Has the chain got contiguous again? */
1435 obj->stat = 2; /* Change the chain status 'contiguous' */
1436 }
1437 } else {
1438 if (obj->stat == 3 && pclst >= obj->sclust && pclst <= obj->sclust + obj->n_cont) { /* Was the chain fragmented in this session and got contiguous again? */
1439 obj->stat = 2; /* Change the chain status 'contiguous' */
1440 }
1441 }
1442 }
1443 }
1444#endif
1445 return FR_OK;
1446}
1447
1448/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1449/* FAT handling - Stretch a chain or Create a new chain */
1450/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1451
1452static DWORD create_chain(/* 0:No free cluster, 1:Internal error, 0xFFFFFFFF:Disk error, >=2:New cluster# */
1453 FFOBJID* obj, /* Corresponding object */
1454 DWORD clst /* Cluster# to stretch, 0:Create a new chain */
1455) {
1456 DWORD cs, ncl, scl;
1457 FRESULT res;
1458 FATFS* fs = obj->fs;
1459
1460 if (clst == 0) { /* Create a new chain */
1461 scl = fs->last_clst; /* Suggested cluster to start to find */
1462 if (scl == 0 || scl >= fs->n_fatent)
1463 scl = 1;
1464 } else { /* Stretch a chain */
1465 cs = get_fat(obj, clst); /* Check the cluster status */
1466 if (cs < 2)
1467 return 1; /* Test for insanity */
1468 if (cs == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1469 return cs; /* Test for disk error */
1470 if (cs < fs->n_fatent)
1471 return cs; /* It is already followed by next cluster */
1472 scl = clst; /* Cluster to start to find */
1473 }
1474 if (fs->free_clst == 0)
1475 return 0; /* No free cluster */
1476
1477#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1478 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* On the exFAT volume */
1479 ncl = find_bitmap(fs, scl, 1); /* Find a free cluster */
1480 if (ncl == 0 || ncl == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1481 return ncl; /* No free cluster or hard error? */
1482 res = change_bitmap(fs, ncl, 1, 1); /* Mark the cluster 'in use' */
1483 if (res == FR_INT_ERR)
1484 return 1;
1485 if (res == FR_DISK_ERR)
1486 return 0xFFFFFFFF;
1487 if (clst == 0) { /* Is it a new chain? */
1488 obj->stat = 2; /* Set status 'contiguous' */
1489 } else { /* It is a stretched chain */
1490 if (obj->stat == 2 && ncl != scl + 1) { /* Is the chain got fragmented? */
1491 obj->n_cont = scl - obj->sclust; /* Set size of the contiguous part */
1492 obj->stat = 3; /* Change status 'just fragmented' */
1493 }
1494 }
1495 if (obj->stat != 2) { /* Is the file non-contiguous? */
1496 if (ncl == clst + 1) { /* Is the cluster next to previous one? */
1497 obj->n_frag = obj->n_frag ? obj->n_frag + 1 : 2; /* Increment size of last framgent */
1498 } else { /* New fragment */
1499 if (obj->n_frag == 0)
1500 obj->n_frag = 1;
1501 res = fill_last_frag(obj, clst, ncl); /* Fill last fragment on the FAT and link it to new one */
1502 if (res == FR_OK)
1503 obj->n_frag = 1;
1504 }
1505 }
1506 } else
1507#endif
1508 { /* On the FAT/FAT32 volume */
1509 ncl = 0;
1510 if (scl == clst) { /* Stretching an existing chain? */
1511 ncl = scl + 1; /* Test if next cluster is free */
1512 if (ncl >= fs->n_fatent)
1513 ncl = 2;
1514 cs = get_fat(obj, ncl); /* Get next cluster status */
1515 if (cs == 1 || cs == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1516 return cs; /* Test for error */
1517 if (cs != 0) { /* Not free? */
1518 cs = fs->last_clst; /* Start at suggested cluster if it is valid */
1519 if (cs >= 2 && cs < fs->n_fatent)
1520 scl = cs;
1521 ncl = 0;
1522 }
1523 }
1524 if (ncl == 0) { /* The new cluster cannot be contiguous and find another fragment */
1525 ncl = scl; /* Start cluster */
1526 for (;;) {
1527 ncl++; /* Next cluster */
1528 if (ncl >= fs->n_fatent) { /* Check wrap-around */
1529 ncl = 2;
1530 if (ncl > scl)
1531 return 0; /* No free cluster found? */
1532 }
1533 cs = get_fat(obj, ncl); /* Get the cluster status */
1534 if (cs == 0)
1535 break; /* Found a free cluster? */
1536 if (cs == 1 || cs == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1537 return cs; /* Test for error */
1538 if (ncl == scl)
1539 return 0; /* No free cluster found? */
1540 }
1541 }
1542 res = put_fat(fs, ncl, 0xFFFFFFFF); /* Mark the new cluster 'EOC' */
1543 if (res == FR_OK && clst != 0) {
1544 res = put_fat(fs, clst, ncl); /* Link it from the previous one if needed */
1545 }
1546 }
1547
1548 if (res == FR_OK) { /* Update FSINFO if function succeeded. */
1549 fs->last_clst = ncl;
1550 if (fs->free_clst <= fs->n_fatent - 2)
1551 fs->free_clst--;
1552 fs->fsi_flag |= 1;
1553 } else {
1554 ncl = (res == FR_DISK_ERR) ? 0xFFFFFFFF : 1; /* Failed. Generate error status */
1555 }
1556
1557 return ncl; /* Return new cluster number or error status */
1558}
1559
1560#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
1561
1562#if FF_USE_FASTSEEK
1563/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1564/* FAT handling - Convert offset into cluster with link map table */
1565/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1566
1567static DWORD clmt_clust(/* <2:Error, >=2:Cluster number */
1568 FIL* fp, /* Pointer to the file object */
1569 FSIZE_t ofs /* File offset to be converted to cluster# */
1570) {
1571 DWORD cl, ncl;
1572 DWORD* tbl;
1573 FATFS* fs = fp->obj.fs;
1574
1575 tbl = fp->cltbl + 1; /* Top of CLMT */
1576 cl = (DWORD)(ofs / SS(fs) / fs->csize); /* Cluster order from top of the file */
1577 for (;;) {
1578 ncl = *tbl++; /* Number of cluters in the fragment */
1579 if (ncl == 0)
1580 return 0; /* End of table? (error) */
1581 if (cl < ncl)
1582 break; /* In this fragment? */
1583 cl -= ncl;
1584 tbl++; /* Next fragment */
1585 }
1586 return cl + *tbl; /* Return the cluster number */
1587}
1588
1589#endif /* FF_USE_FASTSEEK */
1590
1591/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1592/* Directory handling - Fill a cluster with zeros */
1593/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1594
1595#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1596static FRESULT dir_clear(/* Returns FR_OK or FR_DISK_ERR */
1597 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
1598 DWORD clst /* Directory table to clear */
1599) {
1600 LBA_t sect;
1601 UINT n, szb;
1602 BYTE* ibuf;
1603
1604 if (sync_window(fs) != FR_OK)
1605 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Flush disk access window */
1606 sect = clst2sect(fs, clst); /* Top of the cluster */
1607 fs->winsect = sect; /* Set window to top of the cluster */
1608 memset(fs->win, 0, sizeof fs->win); /* Clear window buffer */
1609#if FF_USE_LFN == 3 /* Quick table clear by using multi-secter write */
1610 /* Allocate a temporary buffer */
1611 for (szb = ((DWORD)fs->csize * SS(fs) >= MAX_MALLOC) ? MAX_MALLOC : fs->csize * SS(fs), ibuf = 0; szb > SS(fs) && (ibuf = ff_memalloc(szb)) == 0; szb /= 2)
1612 ;
1613 if (szb > SS(fs)) { /* Buffer allocated? */
1614 memset(ibuf, 0, szb);
1615 szb /= SS(fs); /* Bytes -> Sectors */
1616 for (n = 0; n < fs->csize && disk_write(fs->pdrv, ibuf, sect + n, szb) == RES_OK; n += szb)
1617 ; /* Fill the cluster with 0 */
1618 ff_memfree(ibuf);
1619 } else
1620#endif
1621 {
1622 ibuf = fs->win;
1623 szb = 1; /* Use window buffer (many single-sector writes may take a time) */
1624 for (n = 0; n < fs->csize && disk_write(fs->pdrv, ibuf, sect + n, szb) == RES_OK; n += szb)
1625 ; /* Fill the cluster with 0 */
1626 }
1627 return (n == fs->csize) ? FR_OK : FR_DISK_ERR;
1628}
1629#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
1630
1631/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1632/* Directory handling - Set directory index */
1633/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1634
1635static FRESULT dir_sdi(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, !=0:error */
1636 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to directory object */
1637 DWORD ofs /* Offset of directory table */
1638) {
1639 DWORD csz, clst;
1640 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
1641
1642 if (ofs >= (DWORD)((FF_FS_EXFAT && fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) ? MAX_DIR_EX : MAX_DIR) || ofs % SZDIRE) { /* Check range of offset and alignment */
1643 return FR_INT_ERR;
1644 }
1645 dp->dptr = ofs; /* Set current offset */
1646 clst = dp->obj.sclust; /* Table start cluster (0:root) */
1647 if (clst == 0 && fs->fs_type >= FS_FAT32) { /* Replace cluster# 0 with root cluster# */
1648 clst = (DWORD)fs->dirbase;
1649 if (FF_FS_EXFAT)
1650 dp->obj.stat = 0; /* exFAT: Root dir has an FAT chain */
1651 }
1652
1653 if (clst == 0) { /* Static table (root-directory on the FAT volume) */
1654 if (ofs / SZDIRE >= fs->n_rootdir)
1655 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Is index out of range? */
1656 dp->sect = fs->dirbase;
1657
1658 } else { /* Dynamic table (sub-directory or root-directory on the FAT32/exFAT volume) */
1659 csz = (DWORD)fs->csize * SS(fs); /* Bytes per cluster */
1660 while (ofs >= csz) { /* Follow cluster chain */
1661 clst = get_fat(&dp->obj, clst); /* Get next cluster */
1662 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1663 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Disk error */
1664 if (clst < 2 || clst >= fs->n_fatent)
1665 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Reached to end of table or internal error */
1666 ofs -= csz;
1667 }
1668 dp->sect = clst2sect(fs, clst);
1669 }
1670 dp->clust = clst; /* Current cluster# */
1671 if (dp->sect == 0)
1672 return FR_INT_ERR;
1673 dp->sect += ofs / SS(fs); /* Sector# of the directory entry */
1674 dp->dir = fs->win + (ofs % SS(fs)); /* Pointer to the entry in the win[] */
1675
1676 return FR_OK;
1677}
1678
1679/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1680/* Directory handling - Move directory table index next */
1681/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1682
1683static FRESULT dir_next(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, FR_NO_FILE:End of table, FR_DENIED:Could not stretch */
1684 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1685 int stretch /* 0: Do not stretch table, 1: Stretch table if needed */
1686) {
1687 DWORD ofs, clst;
1688 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
1689
1690 ofs = dp->dptr + SZDIRE; /* Next entry */
1691 if (ofs >= (DWORD)((FF_FS_EXFAT && fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) ? MAX_DIR_EX : MAX_DIR))
1692 dp->sect = 0; /* Disable it if the offset reached the max value */
1693 if (dp->sect == 0)
1694 return FR_NO_FILE; /* Report EOT if it has been disabled */
1695
1696 if (ofs % SS(fs) == 0) { /* Sector changed? */
1697 dp->sect++; /* Next sector */
1698
1699 if (dp->clust == 0) { /* Static table */
1700 if (ofs / SZDIRE >= fs->n_rootdir) { /* Report EOT if it reached end of static table */
1701 dp->sect = 0;
1702 return FR_NO_FILE;
1703 }
1704 } else { /* Dynamic table */
1705 if ((ofs / SS(fs) & (fs->csize - 1)) == 0) { /* Cluster changed? */
1706 clst = get_fat(&dp->obj, dp->clust); /* Get next cluster */
1707 if (clst <= 1)
1708 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Internal error */
1709 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1710 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Disk error */
1711 if (clst >= fs->n_fatent) { /* It reached end of dynamic table */
1712#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1713 if (!stretch) { /* If no stretch, report EOT */
1714 dp->sect = 0;
1715 return FR_NO_FILE;
1716 }
1717 clst = create_chain(&dp->obj, dp->clust); /* Allocate a cluster */
1718 if (clst == 0)
1719 return FR_DENIED; /* No free cluster */
1720 if (clst == 1)
1721 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Internal error */
1722 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
1723 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Disk error */
1724 if (dir_clear(fs, clst) != FR_OK)
1725 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* Clean up the stretched table */
1726 if (FF_FS_EXFAT)
1727 dp->obj.stat |= 4; /* exFAT: The directory has been stretched */
1728#else
1729 if (!stretch)
1730 dp->sect = 0; /* (this line is to suppress compiler warning) */
1731 dp->sect = 0;
1732 return FR_NO_FILE; /* Report EOT */
1733#endif
1734 }
1735 dp->clust = clst; /* Initialize data for new cluster */
1736 dp->sect = clst2sect(fs, clst);
1737 }
1738 }
1739 }
1740 dp->dptr = ofs; /* Current entry */
1741 dp->dir = fs->win + ofs % SS(fs); /* Pointer to the entry in the win[] */
1742
1743 return FR_OK;
1744}
1745
1746#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1747/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1748/* Directory handling - Reserve a block of directory entries */
1749/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1750
1751static FRESULT dir_alloc(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, !=0:error */
1752 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
1753 UINT n_ent /* Number of contiguous entries to allocate */
1754) {
1755 FRESULT res;
1756 UINT n;
1757 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
1758
1759 res = dir_sdi(dp, 0);
1760 if (res == FR_OK) {
1761 n = 0;
1762 do {
1763 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
1764 if (res != FR_OK)
1765 break;
1766#if FF_FS_EXFAT
1767 if ((fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) ? (int)((dp->dir[XDIR_Type] & 0x80) == 0) : (int)(dp->dir[DIR_Name] == DDEM || dp->dir[DIR_Name] == 0)) { /* Is the entry free? */
1768#else
1769 if (dp->dir[DIR_Name] == DDEM || dp->dir[DIR_Name] == 0) { /* Is the entry free? */
1770#endif
1771 if (++n == n_ent)
1772 break; /* Is a block of contiguous free entries found? */
1773 } else {
1774 n = 0; /* Not a free entry, restart to search */
1775 }
1776 res = dir_next(dp, 1); /* Next entry with table stretch enabled */
1777 } while (res == FR_OK);
1778 }
1779
1780 if (res == FR_NO_FILE)
1781 res = FR_DENIED; /* No directory entry to allocate */
1782 return res;
1783}
1784
1785#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
1786
1787/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1788/* FAT: Directory handling - Load/Store start cluster number */
1789/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1790
1791static DWORD ld_clust(/* Returns the top cluster value of the SFN entry */
1792 FATFS* fs, /* Pointer to the fs object */
1793 const BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the key entry */
1794) {
1795 DWORD cl;
1796
1797 cl = ld_word(dir + DIR_FstClusLO);
1798 if (fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32) {
1799 cl |= (DWORD)ld_word(dir + DIR_FstClusHI) << 16;
1800 }
1801
1802 return cl;
1803}
1804
1805#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1806static void st_clust(
1807 FATFS* fs, /* Pointer to the fs object */
1808 BYTE* dir, /* Pointer to the key entry */
1809 DWORD cl /* Value to be set */
1810) {
1811 st_word(dir + DIR_FstClusLO, (WORD)cl);
1812 if (fs->fs_type == FS_FAT32) {
1813 st_word(dir + DIR_FstClusHI, (WORD)(cl >> 16));
1814 }
1815}
1816#endif
1817
1818#if FF_USE_LFN
1819/*--------------------------------------------------------*/
1820/* FAT-LFN: Compare a part of file name with an LFN entry */
1821/*--------------------------------------------------------*/
1822
1823static int cmp_lfn(/* 1:matched, 0:not matched */
1824 const WCHAR* lfnbuf, /* Pointer to the LFN working buffer to be compared */
1825 BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the directory entry containing the part of LFN */
1826) {
1827 UINT i, s;
1828 WCHAR wc, uc;
1829
1830 if (ld_word(dir + LDIR_FstClusLO) != 0)
1831 return 0; /* Check LDIR_FstClusLO */
1832
1833 i = ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & 0x3F) - 1) * 13; /* Offset in the LFN buffer */
1834
1835 for (wc = 1, s = 0; s < 13; s++) { /* Process all characters in the entry */
1836 uc = ld_word(dir + LfnOfs[s]); /* Pick an LFN character */
1837 if (wc != 0) {
1838 if (i >= FF_MAX_LFN + 1 || ff_wtoupper(uc) != ff_wtoupper(lfnbuf[i++])) { /* Compare it */
1839 return 0; /* Not matched */
1840 }
1841 wc = uc;
1842 } else {
1843 if (uc != 0xFFFF)
1844 return 0; /* Check filler */
1845 }
1846 }
1847
1848 if ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & LLEF) && wc && lfnbuf[i])
1849 return 0; /* Last segment matched but different length */
1850
1851 return 1; /* The part of LFN matched */
1852}
1853
1854#if FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || FF_FS_RPATH >= 2 || FF_USE_LABEL || FF_FS_EXFAT
1855/*-----------------------------------------------------*/
1856/* FAT-LFN: Pick a part of file name from an LFN entry */
1857/*-----------------------------------------------------*/
1858
1859static int pick_lfn(/* 1:succeeded, 0:buffer overflow or invalid LFN entry */
1860 WCHAR* lfnbuf, /* Pointer to the LFN working buffer */
1861 BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the LFN entry */
1862) {
1863 UINT i, s;
1864 WCHAR wc, uc;
1865
1866 if (ld_word(dir + LDIR_FstClusLO) != 0)
1867 return 0; /* Check LDIR_FstClusLO is 0 */
1868
1869 i = ((dir[LDIR_Ord] & ~LLEF) - 1) * 13; /* Offset in the LFN buffer */
1870
1871 for (wc = 1, s = 0; s < 13; s++) { /* Process all characters in the entry */
1872 uc = ld_word(dir + LfnOfs[s]); /* Pick an LFN character */
1873 if (wc != 0) {
1874 if (i >= FF_MAX_LFN + 1)
1875 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
1876 lfnbuf[i++] = wc = uc; /* Store it */
1877 } else {
1878 if (uc != 0xFFFF)
1879 return 0; /* Check filler */
1880 }
1881 }
1882
1883 if (dir[LDIR_Ord] & LLEF && wc != 0) { /* Put terminator if it is the last LFN part and not terminated */
1884 if (i >= FF_MAX_LFN + 1)
1885 return 0; /* Buffer overflow? */
1886 lfnbuf[i] = 0;
1887 }
1888
1889 return 1; /* The part of LFN is valid */
1890}
1891#endif
1892
1893#if !FF_FS_READONLY
1894/*-----------------------------------------*/
1895/* FAT-LFN: Create an entry of LFN entries */
1896/*-----------------------------------------*/
1897
1898static void put_lfn(
1899 const WCHAR* lfn, /* Pointer to the LFN */
1900 BYTE* dir, /* Pointer to the LFN entry to be created */
1901 BYTE ord, /* LFN order (1-20) */
1902 BYTE sum /* Checksum of the corresponding SFN */
1903) {
1904 UINT i, s;
1905 WCHAR wc;
1906
1907 dir[LDIR_Chksum] = sum; /* Set checksum */
1908 dir[LDIR_Attr] = AM_LFN; /* Set attribute. LFN entry */
1909 dir[LDIR_Type] = 0;
1910 st_word(dir + LDIR_FstClusLO, 0);
1911
1912 i = (ord - 1) * 13; /* Get offset in the LFN working buffer */
1913 s = wc = 0;
1914 do {
1915 if (wc != 0xFFFF)
1916 wc = lfn[i++]; /* Get an effective character */
1917 st_word(dir + LfnOfs[s], wc); /* Put it */
1918 if (wc == 0)
1919 wc = 0xFFFF; /* Padding characters for following items */
1920 } while (++s < 13);
1921 if (wc == 0xFFFF || !lfn[i])
1922 ord |= LLEF; /* Last LFN part is the start of LFN sequence */
1923 dir[LDIR_Ord] = ord; /* Set the LFN order */
1924}
1925
1926#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
1927#endif /* FF_USE_LFN */
1928
1929#if FF_USE_LFN && !FF_FS_READONLY
1930/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1931/* FAT-LFN: Create a Numbered SFN */
1932/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1933
1934static void gen_numname(
1935 BYTE* dst, /* Pointer to the buffer to store numbered SFN */
1936 const BYTE* src, /* Pointer to SFN in directory form */
1937 const WCHAR* lfn, /* Pointer to LFN */
1938 UINT seq /* Sequence number */
1939) {
1940 BYTE ns[8], c;
1941 UINT i, j;
1942 WCHAR wc;
1943 DWORD sreg;
1944
1945 memcpy(dst, src, 11); /* Prepare the SFN to be modified */
1946
1947 if (seq > 5) { /* In case of many collisions, generate a hash number instead of sequential number */
1948 sreg = seq;
1949 while (*lfn) { /* Create a CRC as hash value */
1950 wc = *lfn++;
1951 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
1952 sreg = (sreg << 1) + (wc & 1);
1953 wc >>= 1;
1954 if (sreg & 0x10000)
1955 sreg ^= 0x11021;
1956 }
1957 }
1958 seq = (UINT)sreg;
1959 }
1960
1961 /* Make suffix (~ + hexadecimal) */
1962 i = 7;
1963 do {
1964 c = (BYTE)((seq % 16) + '0');
1965 seq /= 16;
1966 if (c > '9')
1967 c += 7;
1968 ns[i--] = c;
1969 } while (i && seq);
1970 ns[i] = '~';
1971
1972 /* Append the suffix to the SFN body */
1973 for (j = 0; j < i && dst[j] != ' '; j++) { /* Find the offset to append */
1974 if (dbc_1st(dst[j])) { /* To avoid DBC break up */
1975 if (j == i - 1)
1976 break;
1977 j++;
1978 }
1979 }
1980 do { /* Append the suffix */
1981 dst[j++] = (i < 8) ? ns[i++] : ' ';
1982 } while (j < 8);
1983}
1984#endif /* FF_USE_LFN && !FF_FS_READONLY */
1985
1986#if FF_USE_LFN
1987/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1988/* FAT-LFN: Calculate checksum of an SFN entry */
1989/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1990
1991static BYTE sum_sfn(
1992 const BYTE* dir /* Pointer to the SFN entry */
1993) {
1994 BYTE sum = 0;
1995 UINT n = 11;
1996
1997 do {
1998 sum = (sum >> 1) + (sum << 7) + *dir++;
1999 } while (--n);
2000 return sum;
2001}
2002
2003#endif /* FF_USE_LFN */
2004
2005#if FF_FS_EXFAT
2006/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2007/* exFAT: Checksum */
2008/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2009
2010static WORD xdir_sum(/* Get checksum of the directoly entry block */
2011 const BYTE* dir /* Directory entry block to be calculated */
2012) {
2013 UINT i, szblk;
2014 WORD sum;
2015
2016 szblk = (dir[XDIR_NumSec] + 1) * SZDIRE; /* Number of bytes of the entry block */
2017 for (i = sum = 0; i < szblk; i++) {
2018 if (i == XDIR_SetSum) { /* Skip 2-byte sum field */
2019 i++;
2020 } else {
2021 sum = ((sum & 1) ? 0x8000 : 0) + (sum >> 1) + dir[i];
2022 }
2023 }
2024 return sum;
2025}
2026
2027static WORD xname_sum(/* Get check sum (to be used as hash) of the file name */
2028 const WCHAR* name /* File name to be calculated */
2029) {
2030 WCHAR chr;
2031 WORD sum = 0;
2032
2033 while ((chr = *name++) != 0) {
2034 chr = (WCHAR)ff_wtoupper(chr); /* File name needs to be up-case converted */
2035 sum = ((sum & 1) ? 0x8000 : 0) + (sum >> 1) + (chr & 0xFF);
2036 sum = ((sum & 1) ? 0x8000 : 0) + (sum >> 1) + (chr >> 8);
2037 }
2038 return sum;
2039}
2040
2041#if !FF_FS_READONLY && FF_USE_MKFS
2042static DWORD xsum32(/* Returns 32-bit checksum */
2043 BYTE dat, /* Byte to be calculated (byte-by-byte processing) */
2044 DWORD sum /* Previous sum value */
2045) {
2046 sum = ((sum & 1) ? 0x80000000 : 0) + (sum >> 1) + dat;
2047 return sum;
2048}
2049#endif
2050
2051/*------------------------------------*/
2052/* exFAT: Get a directory entry block */
2053/*------------------------------------*/
2054
2055static FRESULT load_xdir(/* FR_INT_ERR: invalid entry block */
2056 DIR* dp /* Reading directory object pointing top of the entry block to load */
2057) {
2058 FRESULT res;
2059 UINT i, sz_ent;
2060 BYTE* dirb = dp->obj.fs->dirbuf; /* Pointer to the on-memory directory entry block 85+C0+C1s */
2061
2062 /* Load file directory entry */
2063 res = move_window(dp->obj.fs, dp->sect);
2064 if (res != FR_OK)
2065 return res;
2066 if (dp->dir[XDIR_Type] != ET_FILEDIR)
2067 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Invalid order */
2068 memcpy(dirb + 0 * SZDIRE, dp->dir, SZDIRE);
2069 sz_ent = (dirb[XDIR_NumSec] + 1) * SZDIRE;
2070 if (sz_ent < 3 * SZDIRE || sz_ent > 19 * SZDIRE)
2071 return FR_INT_ERR;
2072
2073 /* Load stream extension entry */
2074 res = dir_next(dp, 0);
2075 if (res == FR_NO_FILE)
2076 res = FR_INT_ERR; /* It cannot be */
2077 if (res != FR_OK)
2078 return res;
2079 res = move_window(dp->obj.fs, dp->sect);
2080 if (res != FR_OK)
2081 return res;
2082 if (dp->dir[XDIR_Type] != ET_STREAM)
2083 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Invalid order */
2084 memcpy(dirb + 1 * SZDIRE, dp->dir, SZDIRE);
2085 if (MAXDIRB(dirb[XDIR_NumName]) > sz_ent)
2086 return FR_INT_ERR;
2087
2088 /* Load file name entries */
2089 i = 2 * SZDIRE; /* Name offset to load */
2090 do {
2091 res = dir_next(dp, 0);
2092 if (res == FR_NO_FILE)
2093 res = FR_INT_ERR; /* It cannot be */
2094 if (res != FR_OK)
2095 return res;
2096 res = move_window(dp->obj.fs, dp->sect);
2097 if (res != FR_OK)
2098 return res;
2099 if (dp->dir[XDIR_Type] != ET_FILENAME)
2100 return FR_INT_ERR; /* Invalid order */
2101 if (i < MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN))
2102 memcpy(dirb + i, dp->dir, SZDIRE);
2103 } while ((i += SZDIRE) < sz_ent);
2104
2105 /* Sanity check (do it for only accessible object) */
2106 if (i <= MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN)) {
2107 if (xdir_sum(dirb) != ld_word(dirb + XDIR_SetSum))
2108 return FR_INT_ERR;
2109 }
2110 return FR_OK;
2111}
2112
2113/*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2114/* exFAT: Initialize object allocation info with loaded entry block */
2115/*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2116
2117static void init_alloc_info(
2118 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
2119 FFOBJID* obj /* Object allocation information to be initialized */
2120) {
2121 obj->sclust = ld_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FstClus); /* Start cluster */
2122 obj->objsize = ld_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FileSize); /* Size */
2123 obj->stat = fs->dirbuf[XDIR_GenFlags] & 2; /* Allocation status */
2124 obj->n_frag = 0; /* No last fragment info */
2125}
2126
2127#if !FF_FS_READONLY || FF_FS_RPATH != 0
2128/*------------------------------------------------*/
2129/* exFAT: Load the object's directory entry block */
2130/*------------------------------------------------*/
2131
2132static FRESULT load_obj_xdir(
2133 DIR* dp, /* Blank directory object to be used to access containing directory */
2134 const FFOBJID* obj /* Object with its containing directory information */
2135) {
2136 FRESULT res;
2137
2138 /* Open object containing directory */
2139 dp->obj.fs = obj->fs;
2140 dp->obj.sclust = obj->c_scl;
2141 dp->obj.stat = (BYTE)obj->c_size;
2142 dp->obj.objsize = obj->c_size & 0xFFFFFF00;
2143 dp->obj.n_frag = 0;
2144 dp->blk_ofs = obj->c_ofs;
2145
2146 res = dir_sdi(dp, dp->blk_ofs); /* Goto object's entry block */
2147 if (res == FR_OK) {
2148 res = load_xdir(dp); /* Load the object's entry block */
2149 }
2150 return res;
2151}
2152#endif
2153
2154#if !FF_FS_READONLY
2155/*----------------------------------------*/
2156/* exFAT: Store the directory entry block */
2157/*----------------------------------------*/
2158
2159static FRESULT store_xdir(
2160 DIR* dp /* Pointer to the directory object */
2161) {
2162 FRESULT res;
2163 UINT nent;
2164 BYTE* dirb = dp->obj.fs->dirbuf; /* Pointer to the directory entry block 85+C0+C1s */
2165
