2166 /* Create set sum */
2167 st_word(dirb + XDIR_SetSum, xdir_sum(dirb));
2168 nent = dirb[XDIR_NumSec] + 1;
2169
2170 /* Store the directory entry block to the directory */
2171 res = dir_sdi(dp, dp->blk_ofs);
2172 while (res == FR_OK) {
2173 res = move_window(dp->obj.fs, dp->sect);
2174 if (res != FR_OK)
2175 break;
2176 memcpy(dp->dir, dirb, SZDIRE);
2177 dp->obj.fs->wflag = 1;
2178 if (--nent == 0)
2179 break;
2180 dirb += SZDIRE;
2181 res = dir_next(dp, 0);
2182 }
2183 return (res == FR_OK || res == FR_DISK_ERR) ? res : FR_INT_ERR;
2184}
2185
2186/*-------------------------------------------*/
2187/* exFAT: Create a new directory entry block */
2188/*-------------------------------------------*/
2189
2190static void create_xdir(
2191 BYTE* dirb, /* Pointer to the directory entry block buffer */
2192 const WCHAR* lfn /* Pointer to the object name */
2193) {
2194 UINT i;
2195 BYTE nc1, nlen;
2196 WCHAR wc;
2197
2198 /* Create file-directory and stream-extension entry */
2199 memset(dirb, 0, 2 * SZDIRE);
2200 dirb[0 * SZDIRE + XDIR_Type] = ET_FILEDIR;
2201 dirb[1 * SZDIRE + XDIR_Type] = ET_STREAM;
2202
2203 /* Create file-name entries */
2204 i = SZDIRE * 2; /* Top of file_name entries */
2205 nlen = nc1 = 0;
2206 wc = 1;
2207 do {
2208 dirb[i++] = ET_FILENAME;
2209 dirb[i++] = 0;
2210 do { /* Fill name field */
2211 if (wc != 0 && (wc = lfn[nlen]) != 0)
2212 nlen++; /* Get a character if exist */
2213 st_word(dirb + i, wc); /* Store it */
2214 i += 2;
2215 } while (i % SZDIRE != 0);
2216 nc1++;
2217 } while (lfn[nlen]); /* Fill next entry if any char follows */
2218
2219 dirb[XDIR_NumName] = nlen; /* Set name length */
2220 dirb[XDIR_NumSec] = 1 + nc1; /* Set secondary count (C0 + C1s) */
2221 st_word(dirb + XDIR_NameHash, xname_sum(lfn)); /* Set name hash */
2222}
2223
2224#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
2225#endif /* FF_FS_EXFAT */
2226
2227#if FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || FF_FS_RPATH >= 2 || FF_USE_LABEL || FF_FS_EXFAT
2228/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2229/* Read an object from the directory */
2230/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2231
2232#define DIR_READ_FILE(dp) dir_read(dp, 0)
2233#define DIR_READ_LABEL(dp) dir_read(dp, 1)
2234
2235static FRESULT dir_read(
2236 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
2237 int vol /* Filtered by 0:file/directory or 1:volume label */
2238) {
2239 FRESULT res = FR_NO_FILE;
2240 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
2241 BYTE attr, b;
2242#if FF_USE_LFN
2243 BYTE ord = 0xFF, sum = 0xFF;
2244#endif
2245
2246 while (dp->sect) {
2247 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2248 if (res != FR_OK)
2249 break;
2250 b = dp->dir[DIR_Name]; /* Test for the entry type */
2251 if (b == 0) {
2252 res = FR_NO_FILE;
2253 break; /* Reached to end of the directory */
2254 }
2255#if FF_FS_EXFAT
2256 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* On the exFAT volume */
2257 if (FF_USE_LABEL && vol) {
2258 if (b == ET_VLABEL)
2259 break; /* Volume label entry? */
2260 } else {
2261 if (b == ET_FILEDIR) { /* Start of the file entry block? */
2262 dp->blk_ofs = dp->dptr; /* Get location of the block */
2263 res = load_xdir(dp); /* Load the entry block */
2264 if (res == FR_OK) {
2265 dp->obj.attr = fs->dirbuf[XDIR_Attr] & AM_MASK; /* Get attribute */
2266 }
2267 break;
2268 }
2269 }
2270 } else
2271#endif
2272 { /* On the FAT/FAT32 volume */
2273 dp->obj.attr = attr = dp->dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK; /* Get attribute */
2274#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2275 if (b == DDEM || b == '.' || (int)((attr & ~AM_ARC) == AM_VOL) != vol) { /* An entry without valid data */
2276 ord = 0xFF;
2277 } else {
2278 if (attr == AM_LFN) { /* An LFN entry is found */
2279 if (b & LLEF) { /* Is it start of an LFN sequence? */
2280 sum = dp->dir[LDIR_Chksum];
2281 b &= (BYTE)~LLEF;
2282 ord = b;
2283 dp->blk_ofs = dp->dptr;
2284 }
2285 /* Check LFN validity and capture it */
2286 ord = (b == ord && sum == dp->dir[LDIR_Chksum] && pick_lfn(fs->lfnbuf, dp->dir)) ? ord - 1 : 0xFF;
2287 } else { /* An SFN entry is found */
2288 if (ord != 0 || sum != sum_sfn(dp->dir)) { /* Is there a valid LFN? */
2289 dp->blk_ofs = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* It has no LFN. */
2290 }
2291 break;
2292 }
2293 }
2294#else /* Non LFN configuration */
2295 if (b != DDEM && b != '.' && attr != AM_LFN && (int)((attr & ~AM_ARC) == AM_VOL) == vol) { /* Is it a valid entry? */
2296 break;
2297 }
2298#endif
2299 }
2300 res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
2301 if (res != FR_OK)
2302 break;
2303 }
2304
2305 if (res != FR_OK)
2306 dp->sect = 0; /* Terminate the read operation on error or EOT */
2307 return res;
2308}
2309
2310#endif /* FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || FF_USE_LABEL || FF_FS_RPATH >= 2 */
2311
2312/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2313/* Directory handling - Find an object in the directory */
2314/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2315
2316static FRESULT dir_find(/* FR_OK(0):succeeded, !=0:error */
2317 DIR* dp /* Pointer to the directory object with the file name */
2318) {
2319 FRESULT res;
2320 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
2321 BYTE c;
2322#if FF_USE_LFN
2323 BYTE a, ord, sum;
2324#endif
2325
2326 res = dir_sdi(dp, 0); /* Rewind directory object */
2327 if (res != FR_OK)
2328 return res;
2329#if FF_FS_EXFAT
2330 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* On the exFAT volume */
2331 BYTE nc;
2332 UINT di, ni;
2333 WORD hash = xname_sum(fs->lfnbuf); /* Hash value of the name to find */
2334
2335 while ((res = DIR_READ_FILE(dp)) == FR_OK) { /* Read an item */
2336#if FF_MAX_LFN < 255
2337 if (fs->dirbuf[XDIR_NumName] > FF_MAX_LFN)
2338 continue; /* Skip comparison if inaccessible object name */
2339#endif
2340 if (ld_word(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_NameHash) != hash)
2341 continue; /* Skip comparison if hash mismatched */
2342 for (nc = fs->dirbuf[XDIR_NumName], di = SZDIRE * 2, ni = 0; nc; nc--, di += 2, ni++) { /* Compare the name */
2343 if ((di % SZDIRE) == 0)
2344 di += 2;
2345 if (ff_wtoupper(ld_word(fs->dirbuf + di)) != ff_wtoupper(fs->lfnbuf[ni]))
2346 break;
2347 }
2348 if (nc == 0 && !fs->lfnbuf[ni])
2349 break; /* Name matched? */
2350 }
2351 return res;
2352 }
2353#endif
2354 /* On the FAT/FAT32 volume */
2355#if FF_USE_LFN
2356 ord = sum = 0xFF;
2357 dp->blk_ofs = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
2358#endif
2359 do {
2360 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2361 if (res != FR_OK)
2362 break;
2363 c = dp->dir[DIR_Name];
2364 if (c == 0) {
2365 res = FR_NO_FILE;
2366 break;
2367 } /* Reached to end of table */
2368#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2369 dp->obj.attr = a = dp->dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK;
2370 if (c == DDEM || ((a & AM_VOL) && a != AM_LFN)) { /* An entry without valid data */
2371 ord = 0xFF;
2372 dp->blk_ofs = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
2373 } else {
2374 if (a == AM_LFN) { /* An LFN entry is found */
2375 if (!(dp->fn[NSFLAG] & NS_NOLFN)) {
2376 if (c & LLEF) { /* Is it start of LFN sequence? */
2377 sum = dp->dir[LDIR_Chksum];
2378 c &= (BYTE)~LLEF;
2379 ord = c; /* LFN start order */
2380 dp->blk_ofs = dp->dptr; /* Start offset of LFN */
2381 }
2382 /* Check validity of the LFN entry and compare it with given name */
2383 ord = (c == ord && sum == dp->dir[LDIR_Chksum] && cmp_lfn(fs->lfnbuf, dp->dir)) ? ord - 1 : 0xFF;
2384 }
2385 } else { /* An SFN entry is found */
2386 if (ord == 0 && sum == sum_sfn(dp->dir))
2387 break; /* LFN matched? */
2388 if (!(dp->fn[NSFLAG] & NS_LOSS) && !memcmp(dp->dir, dp->fn, 11))
2389 break; /* SFN matched? */
2390 ord = 0xFF;
2391 dp->blk_ofs = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Reset LFN sequence */
2392 }
2393 }
2394#else /* Non LFN configuration */
2395 dp->obj.attr = dp->dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK;
2396 if (!(dp->dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_VOL) && !memcmp(dp->dir, dp->fn, 11))
2397 break; /* Is it a valid entry? */
2398#endif
2399 res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
2400 } while (res == FR_OK);
2401
2402 return res;
2403}
2404
2405#if !FF_FS_READONLY
2406/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2407/* Register an object to the directory */
2408/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2409
2410static FRESULT dir_register(/* FR_OK:succeeded, FR_DENIED:no free entry or too many SFN collision, FR_DISK_ERR:disk error */
2411 DIR* dp /* Target directory with object name to be created */
2412) {
2413 FRESULT res;
2414 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
2415#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2416 UINT n, len, n_ent;
2417 BYTE sn[12], sum;
2418
2419 if (dp->fn[NSFLAG] & (NS_DOT | NS_NONAME))
2420 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Check name validity */
2421 for (len = 0; fs->lfnbuf[len]; len++)
2422 ; /* Get lfn length */
2423
2424#if FF_FS_EXFAT
2425 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* On the exFAT volume */
2426 n_ent = (len + 14) / 15 + 2; /* Number of entries to allocate (85+C0+C1s) */
2427 res = dir_alloc(dp, n_ent); /* Allocate directory entries */
2428 if (res != FR_OK)
2429 return res;
2430 dp->blk_ofs = dp->dptr - SZDIRE * (n_ent - 1); /* Set the allocated entry block offset */
2431
2432 if (dp->obj.stat & 4) { /* Has the directory been stretched by new allocation? */
2433 dp->obj.stat &= ~4;
2434 res = fill_first_frag(&dp->obj); /* Fill the first fragment on the FAT if needed */
2435 if (res != FR_OK)
2436 return res;
2437 res = fill_last_frag(&dp->obj, dp->clust, 0xFFFFFFFF); /* Fill the last fragment on the FAT if needed */
2438 if (res != FR_OK)
2439 return res;
2440 if (dp->obj.sclust != 0) { /* Is it a sub-directory? */
2441 DIR dj;
2442
2443 res = load_obj_xdir(&dj, &dp->obj); /* Load the object status */
2444 if (res != FR_OK)
2445 return res;
2446 dp->obj.objsize += (DWORD)fs->csize * SS(fs); /* Increase the directory size by cluster size */
2447 st_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FileSize, dp->obj.objsize);
2448 st_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_ValidFileSize, dp->obj.objsize);
2449 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_GenFlags] = dp->obj.stat | 1; /* Update the allocation status */
2450 res = store_xdir(&dj); /* Store the object status */
2451 if (res != FR_OK)
2452 return res;
2453 }
2454 }
2455
2456 create_xdir(fs->dirbuf, fs->lfnbuf); /* Create on-memory directory block to be written later */
2457 return FR_OK;
2458 }
2459#endif
2460 /* On the FAT/FAT32 volume */
2461 memcpy(sn, dp->fn, 12);
2462 if (sn[NSFLAG] & NS_LOSS) { /* When LFN is out of 8.3 format, generate a numbered name */
2463 dp->fn[NSFLAG] = NS_NOLFN; /* Find only SFN */
2464 for (n = 1; n < 100; n++) {
2465 gen_numname(dp->fn, sn, fs->lfnbuf, n); /* Generate a numbered name */
2466 res = dir_find(dp); /* Check if the name collides with existing SFN */
2467 if (res != FR_OK)
2468 break;
2469 }
2470 if (n == 100)
2471 return FR_DENIED; /* Abort if too many collisions */
2472 if (res != FR_NO_FILE)
2473 return res; /* Abort if the result is other than 'not collided' */
2474 dp->fn[NSFLAG] = sn[NSFLAG];
2475 }
2476
2477 /* Create an SFN with/without LFNs. */
2478 n_ent = (sn[NSFLAG] & NS_LFN) ? (len + 12) / 13 + 1 : 1; /* Number of entries to allocate */
2479 res = dir_alloc(dp, n_ent); /* Allocate entries */
2480 if (res == FR_OK && --n_ent) { /* Set LFN entry if needed */
2481 res = dir_sdi(dp, dp->dptr - n_ent * SZDIRE);
2482 if (res == FR_OK) {
2483 sum = sum_sfn(dp->fn); /* Checksum value of the SFN tied to the LFN */
2484 do { /* Store LFN entries in bottom first */
2485 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2486 if (res != FR_OK)
2487 break;
2488 put_lfn(fs->lfnbuf, dp->dir, (BYTE)n_ent, sum);
2489 fs->wflag = 1;
2490 res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
2491 } while (res == FR_OK && --n_ent);
2492 }
2493 }
2494
2495#else /* Non LFN configuration */
2496 res = dir_alloc(dp, 1); /* Allocate an entry for SFN */
2497
2498#endif
2499
2500 /* Set SFN entry */
2501 if (res == FR_OK) {
2502 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2503 if (res == FR_OK) {
2504 memset(dp->dir, 0, SZDIRE); /* Clean the entry */
2505 memcpy(dp->dir + DIR_Name, dp->fn, 11); /* Put SFN */
2506#if FF_USE_LFN
2507 dp->dir[DIR_NTres] = dp->fn[NSFLAG] & (NS_BODY | NS_EXT); /* Put NT flag */
2508#endif
2509 fs->wflag = 1;
2510 }
2511 }
2512
2513 return res;
2514}
2515
2516#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
2517
2518#if !FF_FS_READONLY && FF_FS_MINIMIZE == 0
2519/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2520/* Remove an object from the directory */
2521/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2522
2523static FRESULT dir_remove(/* FR_OK:Succeeded, FR_DISK_ERR:A disk error */
2524 DIR* dp /* Directory object pointing the entry to be removed */
2525) {
2526 FRESULT res;
2527 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
2528#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2529 DWORD last = dp->dptr;
2530
2531 res = (dp->blk_ofs == 0xFFFFFFFF) ? FR_OK : dir_sdi(dp, dp->blk_ofs); /* Goto top of the entry block if LFN is exist */
2532 if (res == FR_OK) {
2533 do {
2534 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2535 if (res != FR_OK)
2536 break;
2537 if (FF_FS_EXFAT && fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* On the exFAT volume */
2538 dp->dir[XDIR_Type] &= 0x7F; /* Clear the entry InUse flag. */
2539 } else { /* On the FAT/FAT32 volume */
2540 dp->dir[DIR_Name] = DDEM; /* Mark the entry 'deleted'. */
2541 }
2542 fs->wflag = 1;
2543 if (dp->dptr >= last)
2544 break; /* If reached last entry then all entries of the object has been deleted. */
2545 res = dir_next(dp, 0); /* Next entry */
2546 } while (res == FR_OK);
2547 if (res == FR_NO_FILE)
2548 res = FR_INT_ERR;
2549 }
2550#else /* Non LFN configuration */
2551
2552 res = move_window(fs, dp->sect);
2553 if (res == FR_OK) {
2554 dp->dir[DIR_Name] = DDEM; /* Mark the entry 'deleted'.*/
2555 fs->wflag = 1;
2556 }
2557#endif
2558
2559 return res;
2560}
2561
2562#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY && FF_FS_MINIMIZE == 0 */
2563
2564#if FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || FF_FS_RPATH >= 2
2565/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2566/* Get file information from directory entry */
2567/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2568
2569static void get_fileinfo(
2570 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
2571 FILINFO* fno /* Pointer to the file information to be filled */
2572) {
2573 UINT si, di;
2574#if FF_USE_LFN
2575 BYTE lcf;
2576 WCHAR wc, hs;
2577 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
2578 UINT nw;
2579#else
2580 TCHAR c;
2581#endif
2582
2583 fno->fname[0] = 0; /* Invaidate file info */
2584 if (dp->sect == 0)
2585 return; /* Exit if read pointer has reached end of directory */
2586
2587#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2588#if FF_FS_EXFAT
2589 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* exFAT volume */
2590 UINT nc = 0;
2591
2592 si = SZDIRE * 2;
2593 di = 0; /* 1st C1 entry in the entry block */
2594 hs = 0;
2595 while (nc < fs->dirbuf[XDIR_NumName]) {
2596 if (si >= MAXDIRB(FF_MAX_LFN)) { /* Truncated directory block? */
2597 di = 0;
2598 break;
2599 }
2600 if ((si % SZDIRE) == 0)
2601 si += 2; /* Skip entry type field */
2602 wc = ld_word(fs->dirbuf + si);
2603 si += 2;
2604 nc++; /* Get a character */
2605 if (hs == 0 && IsSurrogate(wc)) { /* Is it a surrogate? */
2606 hs = wc;
2607 continue; /* Get low surrogate */
2608 }
2609 nw = put_utf((DWORD)hs << 16 | wc, &fno->fname[di], FF_LFN_BUF - di); /* Store it in API encoding */
2610 if (nw == 0) { /* Buffer overflow or wrong char? */
2611 di = 0;
2612 break;
2613 }
2614 di += nw;
2615 hs = 0;
2616 }
2617 if (hs != 0)
2618 di = 0; /* Broken surrogate pair? */
2619 if (di == 0)
2620 fno->fname[di++] = '\?'; /* Inaccessible object name? */
2621 fno->fname[di] = 0; /* Terminate the name */
2622 fno->altname[0] = 0; /* exFAT does not support SFN */
2623
2624 fno->fattrib = fs->dirbuf[XDIR_Attr] & AM_MASKX; /* Attribute */
2625 fno->fsize = (fno->fattrib & AM_DIR) ? 0 : ld_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FileSize); /* Size */
2626 fno->ftime = ld_word(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_ModTime + 0); /* Time */
2627 fno->fdate = ld_word(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_ModTime + 2); /* Date */
2628 return;
2629 } else
2630#endif
2631 { /* FAT/FAT32 volume */
2632 if (dp->blk_ofs != 0xFFFFFFFF) { /* Get LFN if available */
2633 si = di = 0;
2634 hs = 0;
2635 while (fs->lfnbuf[si] != 0) {
2636 wc = fs->lfnbuf[si++]; /* Get an LFN character (UTF-16) */
2637 if (hs == 0 && IsSurrogate(wc)) { /* Is it a surrogate? */
2638 hs = wc;
2639 continue; /* Get low surrogate */
2640 }
2641 nw = put_utf((DWORD)hs << 16 | wc, &fno->fname[di], FF_LFN_BUF - di); /* Store it in API encoding */
2642 if (nw == 0) { /* Buffer overflow or wrong char? */
2643 di = 0;
2644 break;
2645 }
2646 di += nw;
2647 hs = 0;
2648 }
2649 if (hs != 0)
2650 di = 0; /* Broken surrogate pair? */
2651 fno->fname[di] = 0; /* Terminate the LFN (null string means LFN is invalid) */
2652 }
2653 }
2654
2655 si = di = 0;
2656 while (si < 11) { /* Get SFN from SFN entry */
2657 wc = dp->dir[si++]; /* Get a char */
2658 if (wc == ' ')
2659 continue; /* Skip padding spaces */
2660 if (wc == RDDEM)
2661 wc = DDEM; /* Restore replaced DDEM character */
2662 if (si == 9 && di < FF_SFN_BUF)
2663 fno->altname[di++] = '.'; /* Insert a . if extension is exist */
2664#if FF_LFN_UNICODE >= 1 /* Unicode output */
2665 if (dbc_1st((BYTE)wc) && si != 8 && si != 11 && dbc_2nd(dp->dir[si])) { /* Make a DBC if needed */
2666 wc = wc << 8 | dp->dir[si++];
2667 }
2668 wc = ff_oem2uni(wc, CODEPAGE); /* ANSI/OEM -> Unicode */
2669 if (wc == 0) { /* Wrong char in the current code page? */
2670 di = 0;
2671 break;
2672 }
2673 nw = put_utf(wc, &fno->altname[di], FF_SFN_BUF - di); /* Store it in API encoding */
2674 if (nw == 0) { /* Buffer overflow? */
2675 di = 0;
2676 break;
2677 }
2678 di += nw;
2679#else /* ANSI/OEM output */
2680 fno->altname[di++] = (TCHAR)wc; /* Store it without any conversion */
2681#endif
2682 }
2683 fno->altname[di] = 0; /* Terminate the SFN (null string means SFN is invalid) */
2684
2685 if (fno->fname[0] == 0) { /* If LFN is invalid, altname[] needs to be copied to fname[] */
2686 if (di == 0) { /* If LFN and SFN both are invalid, this object is inaccessible */
2687 fno->fname[di++] = '\?';
2688 } else {
2689 for (si = di = 0, lcf = NS_BODY; fno->altname[si]; si++, di++) { /* Copy altname[] to fname[] with case information */
2690 wc = (WCHAR)fno->altname[si];
2691 if (wc == '.')
2692 lcf = NS_EXT;
2693 if (IsUpper(wc) && (dp->dir[DIR_NTres] & lcf))
2694 wc += 0x20;
2695 fno->fname[di] = (TCHAR)wc;
2696 }
2697 }
2698 fno->fname[di] = 0; /* Terminate the LFN */
2699 if (!dp->dir[DIR_NTres])
2700 fno->altname[0] = 0; /* Altname is not needed if neither LFN nor case info is exist. */
2701 }
2702
2703#else /* Non-LFN configuration */
2704 si = di = 0;
2705 while (si < 11) { /* Copy name body and extension */
2706 c = (TCHAR)dp->dir[si++];
2707 if (c == ' ')
2708 continue; /* Skip padding spaces */
2709 if (c == RDDEM)
2710 c = DDEM; /* Restore replaced DDEM character */
2711 if (si == 9)
2712 fno->fname[di++] = '.'; /* Insert a . if extension is exist */
2713 fno->fname[di++] = c;
2714 }
2715 fno->fname[di] = 0; /* Terminate the SFN */
2716#endif
2717
2718 fno->fattrib = dp->dir[DIR_Attr] & AM_MASK; /* Attribute */
2719 fno->fsize = ld_dword(dp->dir + DIR_FileSize); /* Size */
2720 fno->ftime = ld_word(dp->dir + DIR_ModTime + 0); /* Time */
2721 fno->fdate = ld_word(dp->dir + DIR_ModTime + 2); /* Date */
2722}
2723
2724#endif /* FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 || FF_FS_RPATH >= 2 */
2725
2726#if FF_USE_FIND && FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1
2727/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2728/* Pattern matching */
2729/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2730
2731#define FIND_RECURS 4 /* Maximum number of wildcard terms in the pattern to limit recursion */
2732
2733static DWORD get_achar(/* Get a character and advance ptr */
2734 const TCHAR** ptr /* Pointer to pointer to the ANSI/OEM or Unicode string */
2735) {
2736 DWORD chr;
2737
2738#if FF_USE_LFN && FF_LFN_UNICODE >= 1 /* Unicode input */
2739 chr = tchar2uni(ptr);
2740 if (chr == 0xFFFFFFFF)
2741 chr = 0; /* Wrong UTF encoding is recognized as end of the string */
2742 chr = ff_wtoupper(chr);
2743
2744#else /* ANSI/OEM input */
2745 chr = (BYTE) * (*ptr)++; /* Get a byte */
2746 if (IsLower(chr))
2747 chr -= 0x20; /* To upper ASCII char */
2748#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0
2749 if (ExCvt && chr >= 0x80)
2750 chr = ExCvt[chr - 0x80]; /* To upper SBCS extended char */
2751#elif FF_CODE_PAGE < 900
2752 if (chr >= 0x80)
2753 chr = ExCvt[chr - 0x80]; /* To upper SBCS extended char */
2754#endif
2755#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0 || FF_CODE_PAGE >= 900
2756 if (dbc_1st((BYTE)chr)) { /* Get DBC 2nd byte if needed */
2757 chr = dbc_2nd((BYTE) * *ptr) ? chr << 8 | (BYTE) * (*ptr)++ : 0;
2758 }
2759#endif
2760
2761#endif
2762 return chr;
2763}
2764
2765static int pattern_match(/* 0:mismatched, 1:matched */
2766 const TCHAR* pat, /* Matching pattern */
2767 const TCHAR* nam, /* String to be tested */
2768 UINT skip, /* Number of pre-skip chars (number of ?s, b8:infinite (* specified)) */
2769 UINT recur /* Recursion count */
2770) {
2771 const TCHAR* pptr;
2772 const TCHAR* nptr;
2773 DWORD pchr, nchr;
2774 UINT sk;
2775
2776 while ((skip & 0xFF) != 0) { /* Pre-skip name chars */
2777 if (!get_achar(&nam))
2778 return 0; /* Branch mismatched if less name chars */
2779 skip--;
2780 }
2781 if (*pat == 0 && skip)
2782 return 1; /* Matched? (short circuit) */
2783
2784 do {
2785 pptr = pat;
2786 nptr = nam; /* Top of pattern and name to match */
2787 for (;;) {
2788 if (*pptr == '\?' || *pptr == '*') { /* Wildcard term? */
2789 if (recur == 0)
2790 return 0; /* Too many wildcard terms? */
2791 sk = 0;
2792 do { /* Analyze the wildcard term */
2793 if (*pptr++ == '\?') {
2794 sk++;
2795 } else {
2796 sk |= 0x100;
2797 }
2798 } while (*pptr == '\?' || *pptr == '*');
2799 if (pattern_match(pptr, nptr, sk, recur - 1))
2800 return 1; /* Test new branch (recursive call) */
2801 nchr = *nptr;
2802 break; /* Branch mismatched */
2803 }
2804 pchr = get_achar(&pptr); /* Get a pattern char */
2805 nchr = get_achar(&nptr); /* Get a name char */
2806 if (pchr != nchr)
2807 break; /* Branch mismatched? */
2808 if (pchr == 0)
2809 return 1; /* Branch matched? (matched at end of both strings) */
2810 }
2811 get_achar(&nam); /* nam++ */
2812 } while (skip && nchr); /* Retry until end of name if infinite search is specified */
2813
2814 return 0;
2815}
2816
2817#endif /* FF_USE_FIND && FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 1 */
2818
2819/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2820/* Pick a top segment and create the object name in directory form */
2821/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2822
2823static FRESULT create_name(/* FR_OK: successful, FR_INVALID_NAME: could not create */
2824 DIR* dp, /* Pointer to the directory object */
2825 const TCHAR** path /* Pointer to pointer to the segment in the path string */
2826) {
2827#if FF_USE_LFN /* LFN configuration */
2828 BYTE b, cf;
2829 WCHAR wc;
2830 WCHAR* lfn;
2831 const TCHAR* p;
2832 DWORD uc;
2833 UINT i, ni, si, di;
2834
2835 /* Create LFN into LFN working buffer */
2836 p = *path;
2837 lfn = dp->obj.fs->lfnbuf;
2838 di = 0;
2839 for (;;) {
2840 uc = tchar2uni(&p); /* Get a character */
2841 if (uc == 0xFFFFFFFF)
2842 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Invalid code or UTF decode error */
2843 if (uc >= 0x10000)
2844 lfn[di++] = (WCHAR)(uc >> 16); /* Store high surrogate if needed */
2845 wc = (WCHAR)uc;
2846 if (wc < ' ' || IsSeparator(wc))
2847 break; /* Break if end of the path or a separator is found */
2848 if (wc < 0x80 && strchr("*:<>|\"\?\x7F", (int)wc))
2849 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject illegal characters for LFN */
2850 if (di >= FF_MAX_LFN)
2851 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject too long name */
2852 lfn[di++] = wc; /* Store the Unicode character */
2853 }
2854 if (wc < ' ') { /* Stopped at end of the path? */
2855 cf = NS_LAST; /* Last segment */
2856 } else { /* Stopped at a separator */
2857 while (IsSeparator(*p))
2858 p++; /* Skip duplicated separators if exist */
2859 cf = 0; /* Next segment may follow */
2860 if (IsTerminator(*p))
2861 cf = NS_LAST; /* Ignore terminating separator */
2862 }
2863 *path = p; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
2864
2865#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
2866 if ((di == 1 && lfn[di - 1] == '.') || (di == 2 && lfn[di - 1] == '.' && lfn[di - 2] == '.')) { /* Is this segment a dot name? */
2867 lfn[di] = 0;
2868 for (i = 0; i < 11; i++) { /* Create dot name for SFN entry */
2869 dp->fn[i] = (i < di) ? '.' : ' ';
2870 }
2871 dp->fn[i] = cf | NS_DOT; /* This is a dot entry */
2872 return FR_OK;
2873 }
2874#endif
2875 while (di) { /* Snip off trailing spaces and dots if exist */
2876 wc = lfn[di - 1];
2877 if (wc != ' ' && wc != '.')
2878 break;
2879 di--;
2880 }
2881 lfn[di] = 0; /* LFN is created into the working buffer */
2882 if (di == 0)
2883 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject null name */
2884
2885 /* Create SFN in directory form */
2886 for (si = 0; lfn[si] == ' '; si++)
2887 ; /* Remove leading spaces */
2888 if (si > 0 || lfn[si] == '.')
2889 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; /* Is there any leading space or dot? */
2890 while (di > 0 && lfn[di - 1] != '.')
2891 di--; /* Find last dot (di<=si: no extension) */
2892
2893 memset(dp->fn, ' ', 11);
2894 i = b = 0;
2895 ni = 8;
2896 for (;;) {
2897 wc = lfn[si++]; /* Get an LFN character */
2898 if (wc == 0)
2899 break; /* Break on end of the LFN */
2900 if (wc == ' ' || (wc == '.' && si != di)) { /* Remove embedded spaces and dots */
2901 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN;
2902 continue;
2903 }
2904
2905 if (i >= ni || si == di) { /* End of field? */
2906 if (ni == 11) { /* Name extension overflow? */
2907 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN;
2908 break;
2909 }
2910 if (si != di)
2911 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; /* Name body overflow? */
2912 if (si > di)
2913 break; /* No name extension? */
2914 si = di;
2915 i = 8;
2916 ni = 11;
2917 b <<= 2; /* Enter name extension */
2918 continue;
2919 }
2920
2921 if (wc >= 0x80) { /* Is this an extended character? */
2922 cf |= NS_LFN; /* LFN entry needs to be created */
2923#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0
2924 if (ExCvt) { /* In SBCS cfg */
2925 wc = ff_uni2oem(wc, CODEPAGE); /* Unicode ==> ANSI/OEM code */
2926 if (wc & 0x80)
2927 wc = ExCvt[wc & 0x7F]; /* Convert extended character to upper (SBCS) */
2928 } else { /* In DBCS cfg */
2929 wc = ff_uni2oem(ff_wtoupper(wc), CODEPAGE); /* Unicode ==> Up-convert ==> ANSI/OEM code */
2930 }
2931#elif FF_CODE_PAGE < 900 /* In SBCS cfg */
2932 wc = ff_uni2oem(wc, CODEPAGE); /* Unicode ==> ANSI/OEM code */
2933 if (wc & 0x80)
2934 wc = ExCvt[wc & 0x7F]; /* Convert extended character to upper (SBCS) */
2935#else /* In DBCS cfg */
2936 wc = ff_uni2oem(ff_wtoupper(wc), CODEPAGE); /* Unicode ==> Up-convert ==> ANSI/OEM code */
2937#endif
2938 }
2939
2940 if (wc >= 0x100) { /* Is this a DBC? */
2941 if (i >= ni - 1) { /* Field overflow? */
2942 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN;
2943 i = ni;
2944 continue; /* Next field */
2945 }
2946 dp->fn[i++] = (BYTE)(wc >> 8); /* Put 1st byte */
2947 } else { /* SBC */
2948 if (wc == 0 || strchr("+,;=[]", (int)wc)) { /* Replace illegal characters for SFN */
2949 wc = '_';
2950 cf |= NS_LOSS | NS_LFN; /* Lossy conversion */
2951 } else {
2952 if (IsUpper(wc)) { /* ASCII upper case? */
2953 b |= 2;
2954 }
2955 if (IsLower(wc)) { /* ASCII lower case? */
2956 b |= 1;
2957 wc -= 0x20;
2958 }
2959 }
2960 }
2961 dp->fn[i++] = (BYTE)wc;
2962 }
2963
2964 if (dp->fn[0] == DDEM)
2965 dp->fn[0] = RDDEM; /* If the first character collides with DDEM, replace it with RDDEM */
2966
2967 if (ni == 8)
2968 b <<= 2; /* Shift capital flags if no extension */
2969 if ((b & 0x0C) == 0x0C || (b & 0x03) == 0x03)
2970 cf |= NS_LFN; /* LFN entry needs to be created if composite capitals */
2971 if (!(cf & NS_LFN)) { /* When LFN is in 8.3 format without extended character, NT flags are created */
2972 if (b & 0x01)
2973 cf |= NS_EXT; /* NT flag (Extension has small capital letters only) */
2974 if (b & 0x04)
2975 cf |= NS_BODY; /* NT flag (Body has small capital letters only) */
2976 }
2977
2978 dp->fn[NSFLAG] = cf; /* SFN is created into dp->fn[] */
2979
2980 return FR_OK;
2981
2982#else /* FF_USE_LFN : Non-LFN configuration */
2983 BYTE c, d;
2984 BYTE* sfn;
2985 UINT ni, si, i;
2986 const char* p;
2987
2988 /* Create file name in directory form */
2989 p = *path;
2990 sfn = dp->fn;
2991 memset(sfn, ' ', 11);
2992 si = i = 0;
2993 ni = 8;
2994#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
2995 if (p[si] == '.') { /* Is this a dot entry? */
2996 for (;;) {
2997 c = (BYTE)p[si++];
2998 if (c != '.' || si >= 3)
2999 break;
3000 sfn[i++] = c;
3001 }
3002 if (!IsSeparator(c) && c > ' ')
3003 return FR_INVALID_NAME;
3004 *path = p + si; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
3005 sfn[NSFLAG] = (c <= ' ') ? NS_LAST | NS_DOT : NS_DOT; /* Set last segment flag if end of the path */
3006 return FR_OK;
3007 }
3008#endif
3009 for (;;) {
3010 c = (BYTE)p[si++]; /* Get a byte */
3011 if (c <= ' ')
3012 break; /* Break if end of the path name */
3013 if (IsSeparator(c)) { /* Break if a separator is found */
3014 while (IsSeparator(p[si]))
3015 si++; /* Skip duplicated separator if exist */
3016 break;
3017 }
3018 if (c == '.' || i >= ni) { /* End of body or field overflow? */
3019 if (ni == 11 || c != '.')
3020 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Field overflow or invalid dot? */
3021 i = 8;
3022 ni = 11; /* Enter file extension field */
3023 continue;
3024 }
3025#if FF_CODE_PAGE == 0
3026 if (ExCvt && c >= 0x80) { /* Is SBC extended character? */
3027 c = ExCvt[c & 0x7F]; /* To upper SBC extended character */
3028 }
3029#elif FF_CODE_PAGE < 900
3030 if (c >= 0x80) { /* Is SBC extended character? */
3031 c = ExCvt[c & 0x7F]; /* To upper SBC extended character */
3032 }
3033#endif
3034 if (dbc_1st(c)) { /* Check if it is a DBC 1st byte */
3035 d = (BYTE)p[si++]; /* Get 2nd byte */
3036 if (!dbc_2nd(d) || i >= ni - 1)
3037 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject invalid DBC */
3038 sfn[i++] = c;
3039 sfn[i++] = d;
3040 } else { /* SBC */
3041 if (strchr("*+,:;<=>[]|\"\?\x7F", (int)c))
3042 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject illegal chrs for SFN */
3043 if (IsLower(c))
3044 c -= 0x20; /* To upper */
3045 sfn[i++] = c;
3046 }
3047 }
3048 *path = &p[si]; /* Return pointer to the next segment */
3049 if (i == 0)
3050 return FR_INVALID_NAME; /* Reject nul string */
3051
3052 if (sfn[0] == DDEM)
3053 sfn[0] = RDDEM; /* If the first character collides with DDEM, replace it with RDDEM */
3054 sfn[NSFLAG] = (c <= ' ' || p[si] <= ' ') ? NS_LAST : 0; /* Set last segment flag if end of the path */
3055
3056 return FR_OK;
3057#endif /* FF_USE_LFN */
3058}
3059
3060/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3061/* Follow a file path */
3062/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3063
3064static FRESULT follow_path(/* FR_OK(0): successful, !=0: error code */
3065 DIR* dp, /* Directory object to return last directory and found object */
3066 const TCHAR* path /* Full-path string to find a file or directory */
3067) {
3068 FRESULT res;
3069 BYTE ns;
3070 FATFS* fs = dp->obj.fs;
3071
3072#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
3073 if (!IsSeparator(*path) && (FF_STR_VOLUME_ID != 2 || !IsTerminator(*path))) { /* Without heading separator */
3074 dp->obj.sclust = fs->cdir; /* Start at the current directory */
3075 } else
3076#endif
3077 { /* With heading separator */
3078 while (IsSeparator(*path))
3079 path++; /* Strip separators */
3080 dp->obj.sclust = 0; /* Start from the root directory */
3081 }
3082#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3083 dp->obj.n_frag = 0; /* Invalidate last fragment counter of the object */
3084#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
3085 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT && dp->obj.sclust) { /* exFAT: Retrieve the sub-directory's status */
3086 DIR dj;
3087
3088 dp->obj.c_scl = fs->cdc_scl;
3089 dp->obj.c_size = fs->cdc_size;
3090 dp->obj.c_ofs = fs->cdc_ofs;
3091 res = load_obj_xdir(&dj, &dp->obj);
3092 if (res != FR_OK)
3093 return res;
3094 dp->obj.objsize = ld_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FileSize);
3095 dp->obj.stat = fs->dirbuf[XDIR_GenFlags] & 2;
3096 }
3097#endif
3098#endif
3099
3100 if ((UINT)*path < ' ') { /* Null path name is the origin directory itself */
3101 dp->fn[NSFLAG] = NS_NONAME;
3102 res = dir_sdi(dp, 0);
3103
3104 } else { /* Follow path */
3105 for (;;) {
3106 res = create_name(dp, &path); /* Get a segment name of the path */
3107 if (res != FR_OK)
3108 break;
3109 res = dir_find(dp); /* Find an object with the segment name */
3110 ns = dp->fn[NSFLAG];
3111 if (res != FR_OK) { /* Failed to find the object */
3112 if (res == FR_NO_FILE) { /* Object is not found */
3113 if (FF_FS_RPATH && (ns & NS_DOT)) { /* If dot entry is not exist, stay there */
3114 if (!(ns & NS_LAST))
3115 continue; /* Continue to follow if not last segment */
3116 dp->fn[NSFLAG] = NS_NONAME;
3117 res = FR_OK;
3118 } else { /* Could not find the object */
3119 if (!(ns & NS_LAST))
3120 res = FR_NO_PATH; /* Adjust error code if not last segment */
3121 }
3122 }
3123 break;
3124 }
3125 if (ns & NS_LAST)
3126 break; /* Last segment matched. Function completed. */
3127 /* Get into the sub-directory */
3128 if (!(dp->obj.attr & AM_DIR)) { /* It is not a sub-directory and cannot follow */
3129 res = FR_NO_PATH;
3130 break;
3131 }
3132#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3133 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) { /* Save containing directory information for next dir */
3134 dp->obj.c_scl = dp->obj.sclust;
3135 dp->obj.c_size = ((DWORD)dp->obj.objsize & 0xFFFFFF00) | dp->obj.stat;
3136 dp->obj.c_ofs = dp->blk_ofs;
3137 init_alloc_info(fs, &dp->obj); /* Open next directory */
3138 } else
3139#endif
3140 {
3141 dp->obj.sclust = ld_clust(fs, fs->win + dp->dptr % SS(fs)); /* Open next directory */
3142 }
3143 }
3144 }
3145
3146 return res;
3147}
3148
3149/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3150/* Get logical drive number from path name */
3151/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3152
3153static int get_ldnumber(/* Returns logical drive number (-1:invalid drive number or null pointer) */
3154 const TCHAR** path /* Pointer to pointer to the path name */
3155) {
3156 const TCHAR* tp;
3157 const TCHAR* tt;
3158 TCHAR tc;
3159 int i;
3160 int vol = -1;
3161#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID /* Find string volume ID */
3162 const char* sp;
3163 char c;
3164#endif
3165
3166 tt = tp = *path;
3167 if (!tp)
3168 return vol; /* Invalid path name? */
3169 do { /* Find a colon in the path */
3170 tc = *tt++;
3171 } while (!IsTerminator(tc) && tc != ':');
3172
3173 if (tc == ':') { /* DOS/Windows style volume ID? */
3174 i = FF_VOLUMES;
3175 if (IsDigit(*tp) && tp + 2 == tt) { /* Is there a numeric volume ID + colon? */
3176 i = (int)*tp - '0'; /* Get the LD number */
3177 }
3178#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID == 1 /* Arbitrary string is enabled */
3179 else {
3180 i = 0;
3181 do {
3182 sp = VolumeStr[i];
3183 tp = *path; /* This string volume ID and path name */
3184 do { /* Compare the volume ID with path name */
3185 c = *sp++;
3186 tc = *tp++;
3187 if (IsLower(c))
3188 c -= 0x20;
3189 if (IsLower(tc))
3190 tc -= 0x20;
3191 } while (c && (TCHAR)c == tc);
3192 } while ((c || tp != tt) && ++i < FF_VOLUMES); /* Repeat for each id until pattern match */
3193 }
3194#endif
3195 if (i < FF_VOLUMES) { /* If a volume ID is found, get the drive number and strip it */
3196 vol = i; /* Drive number */
3197 *path = tt; /* Snip the drive prefix off */
3198 }
3199 return vol;
3200 }
3201#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID == 2 /* Unix style volume ID is enabled */
3202 if (*tp == '/') { /* Is there a volume ID? */
3203 while (*(tp + 1) == '/')
3204 tp++; /* Skip duplicated separator */
3205 i = 0;
3206 do {
3207 tt = tp;
3208 sp = VolumeStr[i]; /* Path name and this string volume ID */
3209 do { /* Compare the volume ID with path name */
3210 c = *sp++;
3211 tc = *(++tt);
3212 if (IsLower(c))
3213 c -= 0x20;
3214 if (IsLower(tc))
3215 tc -= 0x20;
3216 } while (c && (TCHAR)c == tc);
3217 } while ((c || (tc != '/' && !IsTerminator(tc))) && ++i < FF_VOLUMES); /* Repeat for each ID until pattern match */
3218 if (i < FF_VOLUMES) { /* If a volume ID is found, get the drive number and strip it */
3219 vol = i; /* Drive number */
3220 *path = tt; /* Snip the drive prefix off */
3221 }
3222 return vol;
3223 }
3224#endif
3225 /* No drive prefix is found */
3226#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
3227 vol = CurrVol; /* Default drive is current drive */
3228#else
3229 vol = 0; /* Default drive is 0 */
3230#endif
3231 return vol; /* Return the default drive */
3232}
3233
3234/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3235/* GPT support functions */
3236/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3237
3238#if FF_LBA64
3239
3240/* Calculate CRC32 in byte-by-byte */
3241
3242static DWORD crc32(/* Returns next CRC value */
3243 DWORD crc, /* Current CRC value */
3244 BYTE d /* A byte to be processed */
3245) {
3246 BYTE b;
3247
3248 for (b = 1; b; b <<= 1) {
3249 crc ^= (d & b) ? 1 : 0;
3250 crc = (crc & 1) ? crc >> 1 ^ 0xEDB88320 : crc >> 1;
3251 }
3252 return crc;
3253}
3254
3255/* Check validity of GPT header */
3256
3257static int test_gpt_header(/* 0:Invalid, 1:Valid */
3258 const BYTE* gpth /* Pointer to the GPT header */
3259) {
3260 UINT i;
3261 DWORD bcc, hlen;
3262
3263 if (memcmp(gpth + GPTH_Sign,
3264 "EFI PART"
3265 "\0\0\1",
3266 12))
3267 return 0; /* Check signature and version (1.0) */
3268 hlen = ld_dword(gpth + GPTH_Size); /* Check header size */
3269 if (hlen < 92 || hlen > FF_MIN_SS)
3270 return 0;
3271 for (i = 0, bcc = 0xFFFFFFFF; i < hlen; i++) { /* Check header BCC */
3272 bcc = crc32(bcc, i - GPTH_Bcc < 4 ? 0 : gpth[i]);
3273 }
3274 if (~bcc != ld_dword(gpth + GPTH_Bcc))
3275 return 0;
3276 if (ld_dword(gpth + GPTH_PteSize) != SZ_GPTE)
3277 return 0; /* Table entry size (must be SZ_GPTE bytes) */
3278 if (ld_dword(gpth + GPTH_PtNum) > 128)
3279 return 0; /* Table size (must be 128 entries or less) */
3280
3281 return 1;
3282}
3283
3284#if !FF_FS_READONLY && FF_USE_MKFS
3285
3286/* Generate random value */
3287static DWORD make_rand(
3288 DWORD seed, /* Seed value */
3289 BYTE* buff, /* Output buffer */
3290 UINT n /* Data length */
3291) {
3292 UINT r;
3293
3294 if (seed == 0)
3295 seed = 1;
3296 do {
3297 for (r = 0; r < 8; r++)
3298 seed = seed & 1 ? seed >> 1 ^ 0xA3000000 : seed >> 1; /* Shift 8 bits the 32-bit LFSR */
3299 *buff++ = (BYTE)seed;
3300 } while (--n);
3301 return seed;
3302}
3303
3304#endif
3305#endif
3306
3307/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3308/* Load a sector and check if it is an FAT VBR */
3309/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3310
3311/* Check what the sector is */
3312
3313static UINT check_fs(/* 0:FAT/FAT32 VBR, 1:exFAT VBR, 2:Not FAT and valid BS, 3:Not FAT and invalid BS, 4:Disk error */
3314 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
3315 LBA_t sect /* Sector to load and check if it is an FAT-VBR or not */
3316) {
3317 WORD w, sign;
3318 BYTE b;
3319
3320 fs->wflag = 0;
3321 fs->winsect = (LBA_t)0 - 1; /* Invaidate window */
3322 if (move_window(fs, sect) != FR_OK)
3323 return 4; /* Load the boot sector */
3324 sign = ld_word(fs->win + BS_55AA);
3325#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3326 if (sign == 0xAA55 && !memcmp(fs->win + BS_JmpBoot,
3327 "\xEB\x76\x90"
3328 "EXFAT ",
3329 11))
3330 return 1; /* It is an exFAT VBR */
3331#endif
3332 b = fs->win[BS_JmpBoot];
3333 if (b == 0xEB || b == 0xE9 || b == 0xE8) { /* Valid JumpBoot code? (short jump, near jump or near call) */
3334 if (sign == 0xAA55 && !memcmp(fs->win + BS_FilSysType32, "FAT32 ", 8)) {
3335 return 0; /* It is an FAT32 VBR */
3336 }
3337 /* FAT volumes formatted with early MS-DOS lack BS_55AA and BS_FilSysType, so FAT VBR needs to be identified without them. */
3338 w = ld_word(fs->win + BPB_BytsPerSec);
3339 b = fs->win[BPB_SecPerClus];
3340 if ((w & (w - 1)) == 0 && w >= FF_MIN_SS && w <= FF_MAX_SS /* Properness of sector size (512-4096 and 2^n) */
3341 && b != 0 && (b & (b - 1)) == 0 /* Properness of cluster size (2^n) */
3342 && ld_word(fs->win + BPB_RsvdSecCnt) != 0 /* Properness of reserved sectors (MNBZ) */
3343 && (UINT)fs->win[BPB_NumFATs] - 1 <= 1 /* Properness of FATs (1 or 2) */
3344 && ld_word(fs->win + BPB_RootEntCnt) != 0 /* Properness of root dir entries (MNBZ) */
3345 && (ld_word(fs->win + BPB_TotSec16) >= 128 || ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_TotSec32) >= 0x10000) /* Properness of volume sectors (>=128) */
3346 && ld_word(fs->win + BPB_FATSz16) != 0) { /* Properness of FAT size (MNBZ) */
3347 return 0; /* It can be presumed an FAT VBR */
3348 }
3349 }
3350 return sign == 0xAA55 ? 2 : 3; /* Not an FAT VBR (valid or invalid BS) */
3351}
3352
3353/* Find an FAT volume */
3354/* (It supports only generic partitioning rules, MBR, GPT and SFD) */
3355
3356static UINT find_volume(/* Returns BS status found in the hosting drive */
3357 FATFS* fs, /* Filesystem object */
3358 UINT part /* Partition to fined = 0:find as SFD and partitions, >0:forced partition number */
3359) {
3360 UINT fmt, i;
3361 DWORD mbr_pt[4];
3362
3363 fmt = check_fs(fs, 0); /* Load sector 0 and check if it is an FAT VBR as SFD format */
3364 if (fmt != 2 && (fmt >= 3 || part == 0))
3365 return fmt; /* Returns if it is an FAT VBR as auto scan, not a BS or disk error */
3366
3367 /* Sector 0 is not an FAT VBR or forced partition number wants a partition */
3368
3369#if FF_LBA64
3370 if (fs->win[MBR_Table + PTE_System] == 0xEE) { /* GPT protective MBR? */
3371 DWORD n_ent, v_ent, ofs;
3372 QWORD pt_lba;
3373
3374 if (move_window(fs, 1) != FR_OK)
3375 return 4; /* Load GPT header sector (next to MBR) */
3376 if (!test_gpt_header(fs->win))
3377 return 3; /* Check if GPT header is valid */
3378 n_ent = ld_dword(fs->win + GPTH_PtNum); /* Number of entries */
3379 pt_lba = ld_qword(fs->win + GPTH_PtOfs); /* Table location */
3380 for (v_ent = i = 0; i < n_ent; i++) { /* Find FAT partition */
3381 if (move_window(fs, pt_lba + i * SZ_GPTE / SS(fs)) != FR_OK)
3382 return 4; /* PT sector */
3383 ofs = i * SZ_GPTE % SS(fs); /* Offset in the sector */
3384 if (!memcmp(fs->win + ofs + GPTE_PtGuid, GUID_MS_Basic, 16)) { /* MS basic data partition? */
3385 v_ent++;
3386 fmt = check_fs(fs, ld_qword(fs->win + ofs + GPTE_FstLba)); /* Load VBR and check status */
3387 if (part == 0 && fmt <= 1)
3388 return fmt; /* Auto search (valid FAT volume found first) */
3389 if (part != 0 && v_ent == part)
3390 return fmt; /* Forced partition order (regardless of it is valid or not) */
3391 }
3392 }
3393 return 3; /* Not found */
3394 }
3395#endif
3396 if (FF_MULTI_PARTITION && part > 4)
3397 return 3; /* MBR has 4 partitions max */
3398 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) { /* Load partition offset in the MBR */
3399 mbr_pt[i] = ld_dword(fs->win + MBR_Table + i * SZ_PTE + PTE_StLba);
3400 }
3401 i = part ? part - 1 : 0; /* Table index to find first */
3402 do { /* Find an FAT volume */
3403 fmt = mbr_pt[i] ? check_fs(fs, mbr_pt[i]) : 3; /* Check if the partition is FAT */
3404 } while (part == 0 && fmt >= 2 && ++i < 4);
3405 return fmt;
3406}
3407
3408/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3409/* Determine logical drive number and mount the volume if needed */
3410/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3411
3412static FRESULT mount_volume(/* FR_OK(0): successful, !=0: an error occurred */
3413 const TCHAR** path, /* Pointer to pointer to the path name (drive number) */
3414 FATFS** rfs, /* Pointer to pointer to the found filesystem object */
3415 BYTE mode /* Desiered access mode to check write protection */
3416) {
3417 int vol;
3418 FATFS* fs;
3419 DSTATUS stat;
3420 LBA_t bsect;
3421 DWORD tsect, sysect, fasize, nclst, szbfat;
3422 WORD nrsv;
3423 UINT fmt;
3424
3425 /* Get logical drive number */
3426 *rfs = 0;
3427 vol = get_ldnumber(path);
3428 if (vol < 0)
3429 return FR_INVALID_DRIVE;
3430
3431 /* Check if the filesystem object is valid or not */
3432 fs = FatFs[vol]; /* Get pointer to the filesystem object */
3433 if (!fs)
3434 return FR_NOT_ENABLED; /* Is the filesystem object available? */
3435#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
3436 if (!lock_volume(fs, 1))
3437 return FR_TIMEOUT; /* Lock the volume, and system if needed */
3438#endif
3439 *rfs = fs; /* Return pointer to the filesystem object */
3440
3441 mode &= (BYTE)~FA_READ; /* Desired access mode, write access or not */
3442 if (fs->fs_type != 0) { /* If the volume has been mounted */
3443 stat = disk_status(fs->pdrv);
3444 if (!(stat & STA_NOINIT)) { /* and the physical drive is kept initialized */
3445 if (!FF_FS_READONLY && mode && (stat & STA_PROTECT)) { /* Check write protection if needed */
3446 return FR_WRITE_PROTECTED;
3447 }
3448 return FR_OK; /* The filesystem object is already valid */
3449 }
3450 }
3451
3452 /* The filesystem object is not valid. */
3453 /* Following code attempts to mount the volume. (find an FAT volume, analyze the BPB and initialize the filesystem object) */
3454
3455 fs->fs_type = 0; /* Invalidate the filesystem object */
3456 stat = disk_initialize(fs->pdrv); /* Initialize the volume hosting physical drive */
3457 if (stat & STA_NOINIT) { /* Check if the initialization succeeded */
3458 return FR_NOT_READY; /* Failed to initialize due to no medium or hard error */
3459 }
3460 if (!FF_FS_READONLY && mode && (stat & STA_PROTECT)) { /* Check disk write protection if needed */
3461 return FR_WRITE_PROTECTED;
3462 }
3463#if FF_MAX_SS != FF_MIN_SS /* Get sector size (multiple sector size cfg only) */
3464 if (disk_ioctl(fs->pdrv, GET_SECTOR_SIZE, &SS(fs)) != RES_OK)
3465 return FR_DISK_ERR;
3466 if (SS(fs) > FF_MAX_SS || SS(fs) < FF_MIN_SS || (SS(fs) & (SS(fs) - 1)))
3467 return FR_DISK_ERR;
3468#endif
3469
3470 /* Find an FAT volume on the hosting drive */
3471 fmt = find_volume(fs, LD2PT(vol));
3472 if (fmt == 4)
3473 return FR_DISK_ERR; /* An error occurred in the disk I/O layer */
3474 if (fmt >= 2)
3475 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* No FAT volume is found */
3476 bsect = fs->winsect; /* Volume offset in the hosting physical drive */
3477
3478 /* An FAT volume is found (bsect). Following code initializes the filesystem object */
3479
3480#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3481 if (fmt == 1) {
3482 QWORD maxlba;
3483 DWORD so, cv, bcl, i;
3484
3485 for (i = BPB_ZeroedEx; i < BPB_ZeroedEx + 53 && fs->win[i] == 0; i++)
3486 ; /* Check zero filler */
3487 if (i < BPB_ZeroedEx + 53)
3488 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM;
3489
3490 if (ld_word(fs->win + BPB_FSVerEx) != 0x100)
3491 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* Check exFAT version (must be version 1.0) */
3492
3493 if (1 << fs->win[BPB_BytsPerSecEx] != SS(fs)) { /* (BPB_BytsPerSecEx must be equal to the physical sector size) */
3494 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM;
3495 }
3496
3497 maxlba = ld_qword(fs->win + BPB_TotSecEx) + bsect; /* Last LBA of the volume + 1 */
3498 if (!FF_LBA64 && maxlba >= 0x100000000)
3499 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (It cannot be accessed in 32-bit LBA) */
3500
3501 fs->fsize = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_FatSzEx); /* Number of sectors per FAT */
3502
3503 fs->n_fats = fs->win[BPB_NumFATsEx]; /* Number of FATs */
3504 if (fs->n_fats != 1)
3505 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Supports only 1 FAT) */
3506
3507 fs->csize = 1 << fs->win[BPB_SecPerClusEx]; /* Cluster size */
3508 if (fs->csize == 0)
3509 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must be 1..32768 sectors) */
3510
3511 nclst = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_NumClusEx); /* Number of clusters */
3512 if (nclst > MAX_EXFAT)
3513 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Too many clusters) */
3514 fs->n_fatent = nclst + 2;
3515
3516 /* Boundaries and Limits */
3517 fs->volbase = bsect;
3518 fs->database = bsect + ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_DataOfsEx);
3519 fs->fatbase = bsect + ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_FatOfsEx);
3520 if (maxlba < (QWORD)fs->database + nclst * fs->csize)
3521 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Volume size must not be smaller than the size required) */
3522 fs->dirbase = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_RootClusEx);
3523
3524 /* Get bitmap location and check if it is contiguous (implementation assumption) */
3525 so = i = 0;
3526 for (;;) { /* Find the bitmap entry in the root directory (in only first cluster) */
3527 if (i == 0) {
3528 if (so >= fs->csize)
3529 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* Not found? */
3530 if (move_window(fs, clst2sect(fs, (DWORD)fs->dirbase) + so) != FR_OK)
3531 return FR_DISK_ERR;
3532 so++;
3533 }
3534 if (fs->win[i] == ET_BITMAP)
3535 break; /* Is it a bitmap entry? */
3536 i = (i + SZDIRE) % SS(fs); /* Next entry */
3537 }
3538 bcl = ld_dword(fs->win + i + 20); /* Bitmap cluster */
3539 if (bcl < 2 || bcl >= fs->n_fatent)
3540 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Wrong cluster#) */
3541 fs->bitbase = fs->database + fs->csize * (bcl - 2); /* Bitmap sector */
3542 for (;;) { /* Check if bitmap is contiguous */
3543 if (move_window(fs, fs->fatbase + bcl / (SS(fs) / 4)) != FR_OK)
3544 return FR_DISK_ERR;
3545 cv = ld_dword(fs->win + bcl % (SS(fs) / 4) * 4);
3546 if (cv == 0xFFFFFFFF)
3547 break; /* Last link? */
3548 if (cv != ++bcl)
3549 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* Fragmented bitmap? */
3550 }
3551
3552#if !FF_FS_READONLY
3553 fs->last_clst = fs->free_clst = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Initialize cluster allocation information */
3554#endif
3555 fmt = FS_EXFAT; /* FAT sub-type */
3556 } else
3557#endif /* FF_FS_EXFAT */
3558 {
3559 if (ld_word(fs->win + BPB_BytsPerSec) != SS(fs))
3560 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (BPB_BytsPerSec must be equal to the physical sector size) */
3561
3562 fasize = ld_word(fs->win + BPB_FATSz16); /* Number of sectors per FAT */
3563 if (fasize == 0)
3564 fasize = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_FATSz32);
3565 fs->fsize = fasize;
3566
3567 fs->n_fats = fs->win[BPB_NumFATs]; /* Number of FATs */
3568 if (fs->n_fats != 1 && fs->n_fats != 2)
3569 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must be 1 or 2) */
3570 fasize *= fs->n_fats; /* Number of sectors for FAT area */
3571
3572 fs->csize = fs->win[BPB_SecPerClus]; /* Cluster size */
3573 if (fs->csize == 0 || (fs->csize & (fs->csize - 1)))
3574 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must be power of 2) */
3575
3576 fs->n_rootdir = ld_word(fs->win + BPB_RootEntCnt); /* Number of root directory entries */
3577 if (fs->n_rootdir % (SS(fs) / SZDIRE))
3578 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must be sector aligned) */
3579
3580 tsect = ld_word(fs->win + BPB_TotSec16); /* Number of sectors on the volume */
3581 if (tsect == 0)
3582 tsect = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_TotSec32);
3583
3584 nrsv = ld_word(fs->win + BPB_RsvdSecCnt); /* Number of reserved sectors */
3585 if (nrsv == 0)
3586 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must not be 0) */
3587
3588 /* Determine the FAT sub type */
3589 sysect = nrsv + fasize + fs->n_rootdir / (SS(fs) / SZDIRE); /* RSV + FAT + DIR */
3590 if (tsect < sysect)
3591 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Invalid volume size) */
3592 nclst = (tsect - sysect) / fs->csize; /* Number of clusters */
3593 if (nclst == 0)
3594 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Invalid volume size) */
3595 fmt = 0;
3596 if (nclst <= MAX_FAT32)
3597 fmt = FS_FAT32;
3598 if (nclst <= MAX_FAT16)
3599 fmt = FS_FAT16;
3600 if (nclst <= MAX_FAT12)
3601 fmt = FS_FAT12;
3602 if (fmt == 0)
3603 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM;
3604
3605 /* Boundaries and Limits */
3606 fs->n_fatent = nclst + 2; /* Number of FAT entries */
3607 fs->volbase = bsect; /* Volume start sector */
3608 fs->fatbase = bsect + nrsv; /* FAT start sector */
3609 fs->database = bsect + sysect; /* Data start sector */
3610 if (fmt == FS_FAT32) {
3611 if (ld_word(fs->win + BPB_FSVer32) != 0)
3612 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (Must be FAT32 revision 0.0) */
3613 if (fs->n_rootdir != 0)
3614 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (BPB_RootEntCnt must be 0) */
3615 fs->dirbase = ld_dword(fs->win + BPB_RootClus32); /* Root directory start cluster */
3616 szbfat = fs->n_fatent * 4; /* (Needed FAT size) */
3617 } else {
3618 if (fs->n_rootdir == 0)
3619 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (BPB_RootEntCnt must not be 0) */
3620 fs->dirbase = fs->fatbase + fasize; /* Root directory start sector */
3621 szbfat = (fmt == FS_FAT16) ? /* (Needed FAT size) */
3622 fs->n_fatent * 2
3623 : fs->n_fatent * 3 / 2 + (fs->n_fatent & 1);
3624 }
3625 if (fs->fsize < (szbfat + (SS(fs) - 1)) / SS(fs))
3626 return FR_NO_FILESYSTEM; /* (BPB_FATSz must not be less than the size needed) */
3627
3628#if !FF_FS_READONLY
3629 /* Get FSInfo if available */
3630 fs->last_clst = fs->free_clst = 0xFFFFFFFF; /* Initialize cluster allocation information */
3631 fs->fsi_flag = 0x80;
3632#if (FF_FS_NOFSINFO & 3) != 3
3633 if (fmt == FS_FAT32 /* Allow to update FSInfo only if BPB_FSInfo32 == 1 */
3634 && ld_word(fs->win + BPB_FSInfo32) == 1
3635 && move_window(fs, bsect + 1) == FR_OK) {
3636 fs->fsi_flag = 0;
3637 if (ld_word(fs->win + BS_55AA) == 0xAA55 /* Load FSInfo data if available */
3638 && ld_dword(fs->win + FSI_LeadSig) == 0x41615252
3639 && ld_dword(fs->win + FSI_StrucSig) == 0x61417272) {
3640#if (FF_FS_NOFSINFO & 1) == 0
3641 fs->free_clst = ld_dword(fs->win + FSI_Free_Count);
3642#endif
3643#if (FF_FS_NOFSINFO & 2) == 0
3644 fs->last_clst = ld_dword(fs->win + FSI_Nxt_Free);
3645#endif
3646 }
3647 }
3648#endif /* (FF_FS_NOFSINFO & 3) != 3 */
3649#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
3650 }
3651
3652 fs->fs_type = (BYTE)fmt; /* FAT sub-type (the filesystem object gets valid) */
3653 fs->id = ++Fsid; /* Volume mount ID */
3654#if FF_USE_LFN == 1
3655 fs->lfnbuf = LfnBuf; /* Static LFN working buffer */
3656#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3657 fs->dirbuf = DirBuf; /* Static directory block scratchpad buuffer */
3658#endif
3659#endif
3660#if FF_FS_RPATH != 0
3661 fs->cdir = 0; /* Initialize current directory */
3662#endif
3663#if FF_FS_LOCK /* Clear file lock semaphores */
3664 clear_share(fs);
3665#endif
3666 return FR_OK;
3667}
3668
3669/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3670/* Check if the file/directory object is valid or not */
3671/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3672
3673static FRESULT validate(/* Returns FR_OK or FR_INVALID_OBJECT */
3674 FFOBJID* obj, /* Pointer to the FFOBJID, the 1st member in the FIL/DIR structure, to check validity */
3675 FATFS** rfs /* Pointer to pointer to the owner filesystem object to return */
3676) {
3677 FRESULT res = FR_INVALID_OBJECT;
3678
3679 if (obj && obj->fs && obj->fs->fs_type && obj->id == obj->fs->id) { /* Test if the object is valid */
3680#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
3681 if (lock_volume(obj->fs, 0)) { /* Take a grant to access the volume */
3682 if (!(disk_status(obj->fs->pdrv) & STA_NOINIT)) { /* Test if the hosting phsical drive is kept initialized */
3683 res = FR_OK;
3684 } else {
3685 unlock_volume(obj->fs, FR_OK); /* Invalidated volume, abort to access */
3686 }
3687 } else { /* Could not take */
3688 res = FR_TIMEOUT;
3689 }
3690#else
3691 if (!(disk_status(obj->fs->pdrv) & STA_NOINIT)) { /* Test if the hosting phsical drive is kept initialized */
3692 res = FR_OK;
3693 }
3694#endif
3695 }
3696 *rfs = (res == FR_OK) ? obj->fs : 0; /* Return corresponding filesystem object if it is valid */
3697 return res;
3698}
3699
3700/*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
3701
3702 Public Functions (FatFs API)
3703
3704----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3705
3706/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3707/* Mount/Unmount a Logical Drive */
3708/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3709
3710FRESULT f_mount(
3711 FATFS* fs, /* Pointer to the filesystem object to be registered (NULL:unmount)*/
3712 const TCHAR* path, /* Logical drive number to be mounted/unmounted */
3713 BYTE opt /* Mount option: 0=Do not mount (delayed mount), 1=Mount immediately */
3714) {
3715 FATFS* cfs;
3716 int vol;
3717 FRESULT res;
3718 const TCHAR* rp = path;
3719
3720 /* Get volume ID (logical drive number) */
3721 vol = get_ldnumber(&rp);
3722 if (vol < 0)
3723 return FR_INVALID_DRIVE;
3724 cfs = FatFs[vol]; /* Pointer to the filesystem object of the volume */
3725
3726 if (cfs) { /* Unregister current filesystem object if regsitered */
3727 FatFs[vol] = 0;
3728#if FF_FS_LOCK
3729 clear_share(cfs);
3730#endif
3731#if FF_FS_REENTRANT /* Discard mutex of the current volume */
3732 ff_mutex_delete(vol);
3733#endif
3734 cfs->fs_type = 0; /* Invalidate the filesystem object to be unregistered */
3735 }
3736
3737 if (fs) { /* Register new filesystem object */
3738 fs->pdrv = LD2PD(vol); /* Volume hosting physical drive */
3739#if FF_FS_REENTRANT /* Create a volume mutex */
3740 fs->ldrv = (BYTE)vol; /* Owner volume ID */
3741 if (!ff_mutex_create(vol))
3742 return FR_INT_ERR;
3743#if FF_FS_LOCK
3744 if (SysLock == 0) { /* Create a system mutex if needed */
3745 if (!ff_mutex_create(FF_VOLUMES)) {
3746 ff_mutex_delete(vol);
3747 return FR_INT_ERR;
3748 }
3749 SysLock = 1; /* System mutex is ready */
3750 }
3751#endif
3752#endif
3753 fs->fs_type = 0; /* Invalidate the new filesystem object */
3754 FatFs[vol] = fs; /* Register new fs object */
3755 }
3756
3757 if (opt == 0)
3758 return FR_OK; /* Do not mount now, it will be mounted in subsequent file functions */
3759
3760 res = mount_volume(&path, &fs, 0); /* Force mounted the volume */
3761 LEAVE_FF(fs, res);
3762}
3763
3764/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3765/* Open or Create a File */
3766/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3767
3768FRESULT f_open(
3769 FIL* fp, /* Pointer to the blank file object */
3770 const TCHAR* path, /* Pointer to the file name */
3771 BYTE mode /* Access mode and open mode flags */
3772) {
3773 FRESULT res;
3774 DIR dj;
3775 FATFS* fs;
3776#if !FF_FS_READONLY
3777 DWORD cl, bcs, clst, tm;
3778 LBA_t sc;
3779 FSIZE_t ofs;
3780#endif
3781 DEF_NAMBUF
3782
3783 if (!fp)
3784 return FR_INVALID_OBJECT;
3785
3786 /* Get logical drive number */
3787 mode &= FF_FS_READONLY ? FA_READ : FA_READ | FA_WRITE | FA_CREATE_ALWAYS | FA_CREATE_NEW | FA_OPEN_ALWAYS | FA_OPEN_APPEND;
3788 res = mount_volume(&path, &fs, mode);
3789 if (res == FR_OK) {
3790 dj.obj.fs = fs;
3791 INIT_NAMBUF(fs);
3792 res = follow_path(&dj, path); /* Follow the file path */
3793#if !FF_FS_READONLY /* Read/Write configuration */
3794 if (res == FR_OK) {
3795 if (dj.fn[NSFLAG] & NS_NONAME) { /* Origin directory itself? */
3796 res = FR_INVALID_NAME;
3797 }
3798#if FF_FS_LOCK
3799 else {
3800 res = chk_share(&dj, (mode & ~FA_READ) ? 1 : 0); /* Check if the file can be used */
3801 }
3802#endif
3803 }
3804 /* Create or Open a file */
3805 if (mode & (FA_CREATE_ALWAYS | FA_OPEN_ALWAYS | FA_CREATE_NEW)) {
3806 if (res != FR_OK) { /* No file, create new */
3807 if (res == FR_NO_FILE) { /* There is no file to open, create a new entry */
3808#if FF_FS_LOCK
3809 res = enq_share() ? dir_register(&dj) : FR_TOO_MANY_OPEN_FILES;
3810#else
3811 res = dir_register(&dj);
3812#endif
3813 }
3814 mode |= FA_CREATE_ALWAYS; /* File is created */
3815 } else { /* Any object with the same name is already existing */
3816 if (dj.obj.attr & (AM_RDO | AM_DIR)) { /* Cannot overwrite it (R/O or DIR) */
3817 res = FR_DENIED;
3818 } else {
3819 if (mode & FA_CREATE_NEW)
3820 res = FR_EXIST; /* Cannot create as new file */
3821 }
3822 }
3823 if (res == FR_OK && (mode & FA_CREATE_ALWAYS)) { /* Truncate the file if overwrite mode */
3824#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3825 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
3826 /* Get current allocation info */
3827 fp->obj.fs = fs;
3828 init_alloc_info(fs, &fp->obj);
3829 /* Set directory entry block initial state */
3830 memset(fs->dirbuf + 2, 0, 30); /* Clear 85 entry except for NumSec */
3831 memset(fs->dirbuf + 38, 0, 26); /* Clear C0 entry except for NumName and NameHash */
3832 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_Attr] = AM_ARC;
3833 st_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_CrtTime, GET_FATTIME());
3834 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_GenFlags] = 1;
3835 res = store_xdir(&dj);
3836 if (res == FR_OK && fp->obj.sclust != 0) { /* Remove the cluster chain if exist */
3837 res = remove_chain(&fp->obj, fp->obj.sclust, 0);
3838 fs->last_clst = fp->obj.sclust - 1; /* Reuse the cluster hole */
3839 }
3840 } else
3841#endif
3842 {
3843 /* Set directory entry initial state */
3844 tm = GET_FATTIME(); /* Set created time */
3845 st_dword(dj.dir + DIR_CrtTime, tm);
3846 st_dword(dj.dir + DIR_ModTime, tm);
3847 cl = ld_clust(fs, dj.dir); /* Get current cluster chain */
3848 dj.dir[DIR_Attr] = AM_ARC; /* Reset attribute */
3849 st_clust(fs, dj.dir, 0); /* Reset file allocation info */
3850 st_dword(dj.dir + DIR_FileSize, 0);
3851 fs->wflag = 1;
3852 if (cl != 0) { /* Remove the cluster chain if exist */
3853 sc = fs->winsect;
3854 res = remove_chain(&dj.obj, cl, 0);
3855 if (res == FR_OK) {
3856 res = move_window(fs, sc);
3857 fs->last_clst = cl - 1; /* Reuse the cluster hole */
3858 }
3859 }
3860 }
3861 }
3862 } else { /* Open an existing file */
3863 if (res == FR_OK) { /* Is the object exsiting? */
3864 if (dj.obj.attr & AM_DIR) { /* File open against a directory */
3865 res = FR_NO_FILE;
3866 } else {
3867 if ((mode & FA_WRITE) && (dj.obj.attr & AM_RDO)) { /* Write mode open against R/O file */
3868 res = FR_DENIED;
3869 }
3870 }
3871 }
3872 }
3873 if (res == FR_OK) {
3874 if (mode & FA_CREATE_ALWAYS)
3875 mode |= FA_MODIFIED; /* Set file change flag if created or overwritten */
3876 fp->dir_sect = fs->winsect; /* Pointer to the directory entry */
3877 fp->dir_ptr = dj.dir;
3878#if FF_FS_LOCK
3879 fp->obj.lockid = inc_share(&dj, (mode & ~FA_READ) ? 1 : 0); /* Lock the file for this session */
3880 if (fp->obj.lockid == 0)
3881 res = FR_INT_ERR;
3882#endif
3883 }
3884#else /* R/O configuration */
3885 if (res == FR_OK) {
3886 if (dj.fn[NSFLAG] & NS_NONAME) { /* Is it origin directory itself? */
3887 res = FR_INVALID_NAME;
3888 } else {
3889 if (dj.obj.attr & AM_DIR) { /* Is it a directory? */
3890 res = FR_NO_FILE;
3891 }
3892 }
3893 }
3894#endif
3895
3896 if (res == FR_OK) {
3897#if FF_FS_EXFAT
3898 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
3899 fp->obj.c_scl = dj.obj.sclust; /* Get containing directory info */
3900 fp->obj.c_size = ((DWORD)dj.obj.objsize & 0xFFFFFF00) | dj.obj.stat;
3901 fp->obj.c_ofs = dj.blk_ofs;
3902 init_alloc_info(fs, &fp->obj);
3903 } else
3904#endif
3905 {
3906 fp->obj.sclust = ld_clust(fs, dj.dir); /* Get object allocation info */
3907 fp->obj.objsize = ld_dword(dj.dir + DIR_FileSize);
3908 }
3909#if FF_USE_FASTSEEK
3910 fp->cltbl = 0; /* Disable fast seek mode */
3911#endif
3912 fp->obj.fs = fs; /* Validate the file object */
3913 fp->obj.id = fs->id;
3914 fp->flag = mode; /* Set file access mode */
3915 fp->err = 0; /* Clear error flag */
3916 fp->sect = 0; /* Invalidate current data sector */
3917 fp->fptr = 0; /* Set file pointer top of the file */
3918#if !FF_FS_READONLY
3919#if !FF_FS_TINY
3920 memset(fp->buf, 0, sizeof fp->buf); /* Clear sector buffer */
3921#endif
3922 if ((mode & FA_SEEKEND) && fp->obj.objsize > 0) { /* Seek to end of file if FA_OPEN_APPEND is specified */
3923 fp->fptr = fp->obj.objsize; /* Offset to seek */
3924 bcs = (DWORD)fs->csize * SS(fs); /* Cluster size in byte */
3925 clst = fp->obj.sclust; /* Follow the cluster chain */
3926 for (ofs = fp->obj.objsize; res == FR_OK && ofs > bcs; ofs -= bcs) {
3927 clst = get_fat(&fp->obj, clst);
3928 if (clst <= 1)
3929 res = FR_INT_ERR;
3930 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
3931 res = FR_DISK_ERR;
3932 }
3933 fp->clust = clst;
3934 if (res == FR_OK && ofs % SS(fs)) { /* Fill sector buffer if not on the sector boundary */
3935 sc = clst2sect(fs, clst);
3936 if (sc == 0) {
3937 res = FR_INT_ERR;
3938 } else {
3939 fp->sect = sc + (DWORD)(ofs / SS(fs));
3940#if !FF_FS_TINY
3941 if (disk_read(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, fp->sect, 1) != RES_OK)
3942 res = FR_DISK_ERR;
3943#endif
3944 }
3945 }
3946#if FF_FS_LOCK
3947 if (res != FR_OK)
3948 dec_share(fp->obj.lockid); /* Decrement file open counter if seek failed */
3949#endif
3950 }
3951#endif
3952 }
3953
3954 FREE_NAMBUF();
3955 }
3956
3957 if (res != FR_OK)
3958 fp->obj.fs = 0; /* Invalidate file object on error */
3959
3960 LEAVE_FF(fs, res);
3961}
3962
3963/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3964/* Read File */
3965/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3966
3967FRESULT f_read(
3968 FIL* fp, /* Open file to be read */
3969 void* buff, /* Data buffer to store the read data */
3970 UINT btr, /* Number of bytes to read */
3971 UINT* br /* Number of bytes read */
3972) {
3973 FRESULT res;
3974 FATFS* fs;
3975 DWORD clst;
3976 LBA_t sect;
3977 FSIZE_t remain;
3978 UINT rcnt, cc, csect;
3979 BYTE* rbuff = (BYTE*)buff;
3980
3981 *br = 0; /* Clear read byte counter */
3982 res = validate(&fp->obj, &fs); /* Check validity of the file object */
3983 if (res != FR_OK || (res = (FRESULT)fp->err) != FR_OK)
3984 LEAVE_FF(fs, res); /* Check validity */
3985 if (!(fp->flag & FA_READ))
3986 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_DENIED); /* Check access mode */
3987 remain = fp->obj.objsize - fp->fptr;
3988 if (btr > remain)
3989 btr = (UINT)remain; /* Truncate btr by remaining bytes */
3990
3991 for (; btr > 0; btr -= rcnt, *br += rcnt, rbuff += rcnt, fp->fptr += rcnt) { /* Repeat until btr bytes read */
3992 if (fp->fptr % SS(fs) == 0) { /* On the sector boundary? */
3993 csect = (UINT)(fp->fptr / SS(fs) & (fs->csize - 1)); /* Sector offset in the cluster */
3994 if (csect == 0) { /* On the cluster boundary? */
3995 if (fp->fptr == 0) { /* On the top of the file? */
3996 clst = fp->obj.sclust; /* Follow cluster chain from the origin */
3997 } else { /* Middle or end of the file */
3998#if FF_USE_FASTSEEK
3999 if (fp->cltbl) {
4000 clst = clmt_clust(fp, fp->fptr); /* Get cluster# from the CLMT */
4001 } else
4002#endif
4003 {
4004 clst = get_fat(&fp->obj, fp->clust); /* Follow cluster chain on the FAT */
4005 }
4006 }
4007 if (clst < 2)
4008 ABORT(fs, FR_INT_ERR);
4009 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
4010 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4011 fp->clust = clst; /* Update current cluster */
4012 }
4013 sect = clst2sect(fs, fp->clust); /* Get current sector */
4014 if (sect == 0)
4015 ABORT(fs, FR_INT_ERR);
4016 sect += csect;
4017 cc = btr / SS(fs); /* When remaining bytes >= sector size, */
4018 if (cc > 0) { /* Read maximum contiguous sectors directly */
4019 if (csect + cc > fs->csize) { /* Clip at cluster boundary */
4020 cc = fs->csize - csect;
4021 }
4022 if (disk_read(fs->pdrv, rbuff, sect, cc) != RES_OK)
4023 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4024#if !FF_FS_READONLY && FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 2 /* Replace one of the read sectors with cached data if it contains a dirty sector */
4025#if FF_FS_TINY
4026 if (fs->wflag && fs->winsect - sect < cc) {
4027 memcpy(rbuff + ((fs->winsect - sect) * SS(fs)), fs->win, SS(fs));
4028 }
4029#else
4030 if ((fp->flag & FA_DIRTY) && fp->sect - sect < cc) {
4031 memcpy(rbuff + ((fp->sect - sect) * SS(fs)), fp->buf, SS(fs));
4032 }
4033#endif
4034#endif
4035 rcnt = SS(fs) * cc; /* Number of bytes transferred */
4036 continue;
4037 }
4038#if !FF_FS_TINY
4039 if (fp->sect != sect) { /* Load data sector if not in cache */
4040#if !FF_FS_READONLY
4041 if (fp->flag & FA_DIRTY) { /* Write-back dirty sector cache */
4042 if (disk_write(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, fp->sect, 1) != RES_OK)
4043 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4044 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_DIRTY;
4045 }
4046#endif
4047 if (disk_read(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, sect, 1) != RES_OK)
4048 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR); /* Fill sector cache */
4049 }
4050#endif
4051 fp->sect = sect;
4052 }
4053 rcnt = SS(fs) - (UINT)fp->fptr % SS(fs); /* Number of bytes remains in the sector */
4054 if (rcnt > btr)
4055 rcnt = btr; /* Clip it by btr if needed */
4056#if FF_FS_TINY
4057 if (move_window(fs, fp->sect) != FR_OK)
4058 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR); /* Move sector window */
4059 memcpy(rbuff, fs->win + fp->fptr % SS(fs), rcnt); /* Extract partial sector */
4060#else
4061 memcpy(rbuff, fp->buf + fp->fptr % SS(fs), rcnt); /* Extract partial sector */
4062#endif
4063 }
4064
4065 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_OK);
4066}
4067
4068#if !FF_FS_READONLY
4069/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4070/* Write File */
4071/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4072
4073FRESULT f_write(
4074 FIL* fp, /* Open file to be written */
4075 const void* buff, /* Data to be written */
4076 UINT btw, /* Number of bytes to write */
4077 UINT* bw /* Number of bytes written */
4078) {
4079 FRESULT res;
4080 FATFS* fs;
4081 DWORD clst;
4082 LBA_t sect;
4083 UINT wcnt, cc, csect;
4084 const BYTE* wbuff = (const BYTE*)buff;
4085
4086 *bw = 0; /* Clear write byte counter */
4087 res = validate(&fp->obj, &fs); /* Check validity of the file object */
4088 if (res != FR_OK || (res = (FRESULT)fp->err) != FR_OK)
4089 LEAVE_FF(fs, res); /* Check validity */
4090 if (!(fp->flag & FA_WRITE))
4091 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_DENIED); /* Check access mode */
4092
4093 /* Check fptr wrap-around (file size cannot reach 4 GiB at FAT volume) */
4094 if ((!FF_FS_EXFAT || fs->fs_type != FS_EXFAT) && (DWORD)(fp->fptr + btw) < (DWORD)fp->fptr) {
4095 btw = (UINT)(0xFFFFFFFF - (DWORD)fp->fptr);
4096 }
4097
4098 for (; btw > 0; btw -= wcnt, *bw += wcnt, wbuff += wcnt, fp->fptr += wcnt, fp->obj.objsize = (fp->fptr > fp->obj.objsize) ? fp->fptr : fp->obj.objsize) { /* Repeat until all data written */
4099 if (fp->fptr % SS(fs) == 0) { /* On the sector boundary? */
4100 csect = (UINT)(fp->fptr / SS(fs)) & (fs->csize - 1); /* Sector offset in the cluster */
4101 if (csect == 0) { /* On the cluster boundary? */
4102 if (fp->fptr == 0) { /* On the top of the file? */
4103 clst = fp->obj.sclust; /* Follow from the origin */
4104 if (clst == 0) { /* If no cluster is allocated, */
4105 clst = create_chain(&fp->obj, 0); /* create a new cluster chain */
4106 }
4107 } else { /* On the middle or end of the file */
4108#if FF_USE_FASTSEEK
4109 if (fp->cltbl) {
4110 clst = clmt_clust(fp, fp->fptr); /* Get cluster# from the CLMT */
4111 } else
4112#endif
4113 {
4114 clst = create_chain(&fp->obj, fp->clust); /* Follow or stretch cluster chain on the FAT */
4115 }
4116 }
4117 if (clst == 0)
4118 break; /* Could not allocate a new cluster (disk full) */
4119 if (clst == 1)
4120 ABORT(fs, FR_INT_ERR);
4121 if (clst == 0xFFFFFFFF)
4122 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4123 fp->clust = clst; /* Update current cluster */
4124 if (fp->obj.sclust == 0)
4125 fp->obj.sclust = clst; /* Set start cluster if the first write */
4126 }
4127#if FF_FS_TINY
4128 if (fs->winsect == fp->sect && sync_window(fs) != FR_OK)
4129 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR); /* Write-back sector cache */
4130#else
4131 if (fp->flag & FA_DIRTY) { /* Write-back sector cache */
4132 if (disk_write(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, fp->sect, 1) != RES_OK)
4133 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4134 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_DIRTY;
4135 }
4136#endif
4137 sect = clst2sect(fs, fp->clust); /* Get current sector */
4138 if (sect == 0)
4139 ABORT(fs, FR_INT_ERR);
4140 sect += csect;
4141 cc = btw / SS(fs); /* When remaining bytes >= sector size, */
4142 if (cc > 0) { /* Write maximum contiguous sectors directly */
4143 if (csect + cc > fs->csize) { /* Clip at cluster boundary */
4144 cc = fs->csize - csect;
4145 }
4146 if (disk_write(fs->pdrv, wbuff, sect, cc) != RES_OK)
4147 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4148#if FF_FS_MINIMIZE <= 2
4149#if FF_FS_TINY
4150 if (fs->winsect - sect < cc) { /* Refill sector cache if it gets invalidated by the direct write */
4151 memcpy(fs->win, wbuff + ((fs->winsect - sect) * SS(fs)), SS(fs));
4152 fs->wflag = 0;
4153 }
4154#else
4155 if (fp->sect - sect < cc) { /* Refill sector cache if it gets invalidated by the direct write */
4156 memcpy(fp->buf, wbuff + ((fp->sect - sect) * SS(fs)), SS(fs));
4157 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_DIRTY;
4158 }
4159#endif
4160#endif
4161 wcnt = SS(fs) * cc; /* Number of bytes transferred */
4162 continue;
4163 }
4164#if FF_FS_TINY
4165 if (fp->fptr >= fp->obj.objsize) { /* Avoid silly cache filling on the growing edge */
4166 if (sync_window(fs) != FR_OK)
4167 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4168 fs->winsect = sect;
4169 }
4170#else
4171 if (fp->sect != sect && /* Fill sector cache with file data */
4172 fp->fptr < fp->obj.objsize && disk_read(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, sect, 1) != RES_OK) {
4173 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4174 }
4175#endif
4176 fp->sect = sect;
4177 }
4178 wcnt = SS(fs) - (UINT)fp->fptr % SS(fs); /* Number of bytes remains in the sector */
4179 if (wcnt > btw)
4180 wcnt = btw; /* Clip it by btw if needed */
4181#if FF_FS_TINY
4182 if (move_window(fs, fp->sect) != FR_OK)
4183 ABORT(fs, FR_DISK_ERR); /* Move sector window */
4184 memcpy(fs->win + fp->fptr % SS(fs), wbuff, wcnt); /* Fit data to the sector */
4185 fs->wflag = 1;
4186#else
4187 memcpy(fp->buf + fp->fptr % SS(fs), wbuff, wcnt); /* Fit data to the sector */
4188 fp->flag |= FA_DIRTY;
4189#endif
4190 }
4191
4192 fp->flag |= FA_MODIFIED; /* Set file change flag */
4193
4194 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_OK);
4195}
4196
4197/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4198/* Synchronize the File */
4199/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4200
4201FRESULT f_sync(
4202 FIL* fp /* Open file to be synced */
4203) {
4204 FRESULT res;
4205 FATFS* fs;
4206 DWORD tm;
4207 BYTE* dir;
4208
4209 res = validate(&fp->obj, &fs); /* Check validity of the file object */
4210 if (res == FR_OK) {
4211 if (fp->flag & FA_MODIFIED) { /* Is there any change to the file? */
4212#if !FF_FS_TINY
4213 if (fp->flag & FA_DIRTY) { /* Write-back cached data if needed */
4214 if (disk_write(fs->pdrv, fp->buf, fp->sect, 1) != RES_OK)
4215 LEAVE_FF(fs, FR_DISK_ERR);
4216 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_DIRTY;
4217 }
4218#endif
4219 /* Update the directory entry */
4220 tm = GET_FATTIME(); /* Modified time */
4221#if FF_FS_EXFAT
4222 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
4223 res = fill_first_frag(&fp->obj); /* Fill first fragment on the FAT if needed */
4224 if (res == FR_OK) {
4225 res = fill_last_frag(&fp->obj, fp->clust, 0xFFFFFFFF); /* Fill last fragment on the FAT if needed */
4226 }
4227 if (res == FR_OK) {
4228 DIR dj;
4229 DEF_NAMBUF
4230
4231 INIT_NAMBUF(fs);
4232 res = load_obj_xdir(&dj, &fp->obj); /* Load directory entry block */
4233 if (res == FR_OK) {
4234 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_Attr] |= AM_ARC; /* Set archive attribute to indicate that the file has been changed */
4235 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_GenFlags] = fp->obj.stat | 1; /* Update file allocation information */
4236 st_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FstClus, fp->obj.sclust); /* Update start cluster */
4237 st_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FileSize, fp->obj.objsize); /* Update file size */
4238 st_qword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_ValidFileSize, fp->obj.objsize); /* (FatFs does not support Valid File Size feature) */
4239 st_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_ModTime, tm); /* Update modified time */
4240 fs->dirbuf[XDIR_ModTime10] = 0;
4241 st_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_AccTime, 0);
4242 res = store_xdir(&dj); /* Restore it to the directory */
4243 if (res == FR_OK) {
4244 res = sync_fs(fs);
4245 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_MODIFIED;
4246 }
4247 }
4248 FREE_NAMBUF();
4249 }
4250 } else
4251#endif
4252 {
4253 res = move_window(fs, fp->dir_sect);
4254 if (res == FR_OK) {
4255 dir = fp->dir_ptr;
4256 dir[DIR_Attr] |= AM_ARC; /* Set archive attribute to indicate that the file has been changed */
4257 st_clust(fp->obj.fs, dir, fp->obj.sclust); /* Update file allocation information */
4258 st_dword(dir + DIR_FileSize, (DWORD)fp->obj.objsize); /* Update file size */
4259 st_dword(dir + DIR_ModTime, tm); /* Update modified time */
4260 st_word(dir + DIR_LstAccDate, 0);
4261 fs->wflag = 1;
4262 res = sync_fs(fs); /* Restore it to the directory */
4263 fp->flag &= (BYTE)~FA_MODIFIED;
4264 }
4265 }
4266 }
4267 }
4268
4269 LEAVE_FF(fs, res);
4270}
4271
4272#endif /* !FF_FS_READONLY */
4273
4274/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4275/* Close File */
4276/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4277
4278FRESULT f_close(
4279 FIL* fp /* Open file to be closed */
4280) {
4281 FRESULT res;
4282 FATFS* fs;
4283
4284#if !FF_FS_READONLY
4285 res = f_sync(fp); /* Flush cached data */
4286 if (res == FR_OK)
4287#endif
4288 {
4289 res = validate(&fp->obj, &fs); /* Lock volume */
4290 if (res == FR_OK) {
4291#if FF_FS_LOCK
4292 res = dec_share(fp->obj.lockid); /* Decrement file open counter */
4293 if (res == FR_OK)
4294 fp->obj.fs = 0; /* Invalidate file object */
4295#else
4296 fp->obj.fs = 0; /* Invalidate file object */
4297#endif
4298#if FF_FS_REENTRANT
4299 unlock_volume(fs, FR_OK); /* Unlock volume */
4300#endif
4301 }
4302 }
4303 return res;
4304}
4305
4306#if FF_FS_RPATH >= 1
4307/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4308/* Change Current Directory or Current Drive, Get Current Directory */
4309/*-----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4310
4311FRESULT f_chdrive(
4312 const TCHAR* path /* Drive number to set */
4313) {
4314 int vol;
4315
4316 /* Get logical drive number */
4317 vol = get_ldnumber(&path);
4318 if (vol < 0)
4319 return FR_INVALID_DRIVE;
4320 CurrVol = (BYTE)vol; /* Set it as current volume */
4321
4322 return FR_OK;
4323}
4324
4325FRESULT f_chdir(
4326 const TCHAR* path /* Pointer to the directory path */
4327) {
4328#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID == 2
4329 UINT i;
4330#endif
4331 FRESULT res;
4332 DIR dj;
4333 FATFS* fs;
4334 DEF_NAMBUF
4335
4336 /* Get logical drive */
4337 res = mount_volume(&path, &fs, 0);
4338 if (res == FR_OK) {
4339 dj.obj.fs = fs;
4340 INIT_NAMBUF(fs);
4341 res = follow_path(&dj, path); /* Follow the path */
4342 if (res == FR_OK) { /* Follow completed */
4343 if (dj.fn[NSFLAG] & NS_NONAME) { /* Is it the start directory itself? */
4344 fs->cdir = dj.obj.sclust;
4345#if FF_FS_EXFAT
4346 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
4347 fs->cdc_scl = dj.obj.c_scl;
4348 fs->cdc_size = dj.obj.c_size;
4349 fs->cdc_ofs = dj.obj.c_ofs;
4350 }
4351#endif
4352 } else {
4353 if (dj.obj.attr & AM_DIR) { /* It is a sub-directory */
4354#if FF_FS_EXFAT
4355 if (fs->fs_type == FS_EXFAT) {
4356 fs->cdir = ld_dword(fs->dirbuf + XDIR_FstClus); /* Sub-directory cluster */
4357 fs->cdc_scl = dj.obj.sclust; /* Save containing directory information */
4358 fs->cdc_size = ((DWORD)dj.obj.objsize & 0xFFFFFF00) | dj.obj.stat;
4359 fs->cdc_ofs = dj.blk_ofs;
4360 } else
4361#endif
4362 {
4363 fs->cdir = ld_clust(fs, dj.dir); /* Sub-directory cluster */
4364 }
4365 } else {
4366 res = FR_NO_PATH; /* Reached but a file */
4367 }
4368 }
4369 }
4370 FREE_NAMBUF();
4371 if (res == FR_NO_FILE)
4372 res = FR_NO_PATH;
4373#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID == 2 /* Also current drive is changed if in Unix style volume ID */
4374 if (res == FR_OK) {
4375 for (i = FF_VOLUMES - 1; i && fs != FatFs[i]; i--)
4376 ; /* Set current drive */
4377 CurrVol = (BYTE)i;
4378 }
4379#endif
4380 }
4381
4382 LEAVE_FF(fs, res);
4383}
4384
4385#if FF_FS_RPATH >= 2
4386FRESULT f_getcwd(
4387 TCHAR* buff, /* Pointer to the directory path */
4388 UINT len /* Size of buff in unit of TCHAR */
4389) {
4390 FRESULT res;
4391 DIR dj;
4392 FATFS* fs;
4393 UINT i, n;
4394 DWORD ccl;
4395 TCHAR* tp = buff;
4396#if FF_VOLUMES >= 2
4397 UINT vl;
4398#if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID
4399 const char* vp;
4400#endif
4401#endif
4402 FILINFO fno;
4403 DEF_NAMBUF
4404
4405 /* Get logical drive */
4406 buff[0] = 0; /* Set null string to get current volume */
4407 res = mount_volume((const TCHAR**)&buff, &fs, 0); /* Get current volume */
4408 if (res == FR_OK) {
4409 dj.obj.fs = fs;
4410 INIT_NAMBUF(fs);
4411
4412 /* Follow parent directories and create the path */
4413 i = len; /* Bottom of buffer (directory stack base) */
4414 if (!FF_FS_EXFAT || fs->fs_type != FS_EXFAT) { /* (Cannot do getcwd on exFAT and returns root path) */
4415 dj.obj.sclust = fs->cdir; /* Start to follow upper directory from current directory */
4416 while ((ccl = dj.obj.sclust) != 0) { /* Repeat while current directory is a sub-directory */
4417 res = dir_sdi(&dj, 1 * SZDIRE); /* Get parent directory */
4418 if (res != FR_OK)
4419 break;
4420 res = move_window(fs, dj.sect);
4421 if (res != FR_OK)
4422 break;
4423 dj.obj.sclust = ld_clust(fs, dj.dir); /* Goto parent directory */
4424 res = dir_sdi(&dj, 0);
4425 if (res != FR_OK)
4426 break;
4427 do { /* Find the entry links to the child directory */
